edu.description: Course Description: Introduction to concepts and methods of policy analysis. Emphasis on the relationship between educational issues and problems; policy development; constructing persuasive policy analyses; issues related to policy process.

edu.name: — Culture & Social Organization of Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Culture and social organization of schools. Examines perspectives of social researchers, educational policy-makers, and school members and their implications for educational research, policy and practice.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — School Change & Educational Reform
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis of models, processes, and case studies of school change and educational reform with respect to variable characteristics of schools and schooling, planned and unplanned change, the moral evaluation of school change, and the role of educational research.

edu.name: — Education & Social Policy
edu.description: Course Description: Focuses on understanding the social and political context of education in the U.S. and California and how education policy is formed in the broader public arena. Develops skills in educational policy analysis. (Former EDU 237.)
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Education Policy & Law
edu.description: Course Description: Examination of law as an instrument of social policy. Specific focus on the legalization of education decision making, its causes, dimensions, and effects on administrative and teacher authority.

edu.name: — Culture & Social Organization of Higher Education
edu.description: Course Description: Critical study of culture and social organization of higher education institutions policies and functions in the U.S., with some attention to other countries.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Politics & Governance of Education
edu.description: Course Description: Examination of political power, representation, influence, decision-making and inter-governmental relations in the public schools.

edu.name: — Education Finance Policy
edu.description: Course Description: Examination of (1) United States financing public education, (2) the relationship between school finance and education policy, and (3) the relationship between education finance and education practice.

edu.name: — Special Topics in Education Policy
edu.description: Course Description: Selected topics in education policy. Designed to facilitate preparation for the qualifying examination or dissertation. Critically analyze scholarly work including their own works in progress.

edu.name: — Critical Pedagogy
edu.description: Course Description: A socio-cultural critique, from an interdisciplinary perspective, of educational reform and change. The critique will include an analysis of the influence of text content on the perpetuation of social power differences.

edu.name: — Application of Hierarchical Linear Models in Education Research
edu.description: Course Description: Application of hierarchical linear models in education research across multiple areas, such as policy, curriculum, and assessment. Develop working knowledge of hierarchical linear modeling and an understanding of its use in existing research as well as student's work.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EDU 204A; or similar course with permission of the instructor.

edu.name: — Survey Research Methods
edu.description: Course Description: Theories, principles and application of survey research methodology. Students develop, validate, and administer survey instruments; select representative samples; conduct focus groups; and collect, organize, and analyze survey data. Familiarity with introductory concepts in descriptive and inferential statistics is assumed.

edu.name: — Participatory Action Research (PAR)
edu.description: Course Description: Principles and strategies of PAR and related methodologies that emphasize collaborating with those affected by the issue being researched in order to educate, take action or effect social change. Conduct interviews with potential collaborators, case analyses and research proposals.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Introductory research methods course recommended.

edu.name: — Interview Methods
edu.description: Course Description: Introduction to qualitative interviewing, focused in particular on narrative and self-story as both practical method and theoretical stance. Complete a case-focused interview project during the course: designing an interview protocol, conducting the interview, transcribing, analyzing, and presenting their research.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EDU 201 or equivalent course recommended.

edu.name: — Research on Text Comprehension
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis of recent research related to cognitive processing of written texts. Topics include word decoding, schema theory, background knowledge, assimilation, accommodation, working memory, processing depth, vocabulary acquisition, sentence-level processes, text-level processes, text structure, implications for curriculum and instruction.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research on the Teaching & Learning of Writing
edu.description: Course Description: Study of issues in research on composition; history of composition studies; data analysis techniques; product and process approaches; cognitive and social perspectives.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Topical Seminar in Language, Literacy & Culture
edu.description: Course Description: Critical study of selected issues of language, literacy, and culture as they relate to education.

edu.name: — Theory & Research in Early Literacy
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis of children's initial processes in learning to read extending from the preschool years into second grade. Topics include emergent literacy, phonological awareness, word recognition, decoding, spelling, vocabulary, comprehension, second language reading, assessment, intervention, and instruction.

edu.name: — Reading as a Social & Cultural Process
edu.description: Course Description: Recent theoretical and empirical work on reading in social contexts. Topics include reading as an individual interactive process; reading as a social and cultural process; critical perspectives on reading; implications of contrastive theoretical perspectives for curriculum and instruction in reading.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EDU 211 recommended.

edu.name: — Research on Response to Culturally Diverse Literature, K-12
edu.description: Course Description: Research on response to culturally diverse literature in classrooms and other K-12 settings. Topics include reader response theories, values in expanding the literary canon, problems of cultural authenticity, resistance to multicultural literature, and instruction for diverse texts and learners.

edu.name: — Academic Language & Literacies
edu.description: Course Description: Exploration of theories and research on academic language and literacies for the schooling of first and second language learners. Students use basic qualitative methods to collect and analyze classroom language and literacy data.

edu.name: — Discourse Analysis in Educational Settings
edu.description: Course Description: Examines form and type in discourse (e.g., narration, conversation, routines), approaches to discourse analysis, and research on classroom discourse (lessons, teaching/learning interactional sequences). Final term paper is an analysis of discourse data tape-recorded by student in a field setting.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): An introductory linguistics or sociolinguistics course or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research in Bilingual & Second Language Education
edu.description: Course Description: Discussion and analysis of recent research in bilingual and second language education. Topics include:language acquisition in second language learners and bilinguals, second language teaching methods, language-use models in bilingual education, interaction analysis in bilingual/cross-cultural classrooms,use of the vernacular in classrooms.

edu.name: — Inquiry into Classroom Practice: Bilingual Methods
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis and application of teacher research through the development, implementation and evaluation of a short-term research-based classroom intervention. Research that enhances learning of multilingual language learners.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Curriculum Development & Evaluation in Mathematics
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis of curricular issues and goals in mathematics education, including long-term trends, current status and influences, proposed changes, and evaluation issues. Selected curriculum projects examined.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research in Mathematics Education
edu.description: Course Description: Examination of research process in mathematics education; review of critical productive problems identified by researchers; evolution of trends, issues, theories and hypotheses in various areas of mathematics education research. Emphasizes foundations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research in Mathematics Education
edu.description: Course Description: Current research issues and activities in mathematics education: status, trends, theories and hypotheses. Formulation of research questions and design of studies. Projection of future directions for research.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Computer Technology in Mathematics Education
edu.description: Course Description: Roles of calculators, computers, and graphing calculators in mathematics education will be addressed, with emphasis on the impact of these technologies on curriculum reform. Selected efforts to integrate technology into mathematics instruction will be examined.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — The Modern History of Science Education
edu.description: Course Description: History of curricular issues and goals in science education from the late-19th century forward, including long-term trends, current status and influences, proposed changes, and evaluation issues. National science standards and curriculum projects.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research Topics in Science Education I
edu.description: Course Description: Research process and product in science education; review of critical science education issues; evolution of trends, theories and hypotheses in various areas of science education research. Survey of current major research in science education.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research Topics in Science Education II
edu.description: Course Description: Current research issues and activities in science education: status, trends, theories and hypotheses. Formulation of research questions, design of studies and critical, in-depth review of literature related to the student's research interests.

edu.name: — Scientific Literacy & Science Education Reform
edu.description: Course Description: Current trends in science education reform locally, regionally, and nationally focusing on scientific literacy. Equity, access and "science for all."
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research on Teacher Education & Development
edu.description: Course Description: Research on teacher preparation in university credential programs and on professional development of in-service teachers, with special attention to teacher preparation for work with culturally and linguistically diverse youth.

edu.name: — Supervision of Student Teachers: Research, Theory & Practice
edu.description: Course Description: Research, theory and practice in the preparation and supervision of teachers. Practice in the supervision of candidates in university teaching credential programs during the student teaching field placement and the mentoring of novice teachers by expert teachers.

edu.name: — Effective Instruction: Curriculum & Assessment-Theory, Research, & Practice
edu.description: Course Description: Examination of contemporary theories of curriculum development, research about the relationship among instructional planning, classroom assessment, and student learning to guide teaching practice.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Effective Instruction: English Language Development & Instructing English Language Learners
edu.description: Course Description: Analysis and application of English language acquisition and development research to teaching practice. Particular attention to research that enhances learning of English language learners and under-performing students.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in the Teaching Credential Program.

edu.name: — Inquiry & Practice: Qualitative Research for Educational Leaders
edu.description: Course Description: Prepares students to understand the nature/assumptions/logic of qualitative methodology as applied to educational settings, focusing on issues of design/conceptualization/ interpretation/application of qualitative research procedures. Use these methods in conducting studies in their educational settings.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Inquiry & Practice: Quantitative Research for Educational Leaders
edu.description: Course Description: Focus is on field-based and general quantitative research methods in education. Acquire skills and knowledge to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret univariate and multivariate quantitative data in educational research, dissertation projects, and field-based projects.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Inquiry & Practice: Research Design & Application for Educational Leaders
edu.description: Course Description: Educational leaders are introduced to qualitative, quantitative, and mixed-methods educational research methods and learn to frame research questions, identify data/data sources, use descriptive statistics, critically examine research studies, make sense of educational research/policy, and conduct independent studies.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Problem-Based Learning Courses: Part 1
edu.description: Course Description: Students identify problems from their educational settings, engage in data collection/analysis, write-up the process/results, and present to class. Work may become a dissertation proposal, if the problem or its extension is of sufficient interest and value.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Problem-Based Learning Courses: Part 2
edu.description: Course Description: Continuation of part one.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Problem-Based Learning Courses: Part 3
edu.description: Course Description: Continuation of part two.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Beginning Issues & Practices: Contemporary Educational Leadership
edu.description: Course Description: Explore the history and emergent relationships among leadership theories/practice and their application to current educational settings. Reflect on and refine their personal theory of leadership.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Beginning Issues & Practices: Diversity Issues for Educational Leaders
edu.description: Course Description: Diversity of stakeholders and community issues in California schools and colleges will be explored. Emphasis will be placed on the interaction between underrepresented segments of society and educational institutions. Best Practices in leading diverse schools will be explored.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Advanced Issues & Practices: Leadership Across Communities
edu.description: Course Description: Examine the theory/practice/process of leadership in community-building and collaboration in/across communities, while addressing the utilization of human and material resources and the creation of partnerships, community linkages, and collaborative efforts.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Advanced Issues & Practices: Leadership & Student Services
edu.description: Course Description: Practical and theoretical perspectives for building a sense of vision to lead the profession of student affairs and to meet the needs of the whole student.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Policy: History & Theory of Educational Policy
edu.description: Course Description: Learn/analyze the history/theory of educational policy. Explore how education leaders have/can positively influence the  process and implement effective policies in their local institutions. Policy issues covered: educational opportunity, equity, access, regulation, testing, tenure, accountability.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Policy: Formulating & Influencing Policy
edu.description: Course Description: Conduct critical analyses of policy at the federal, judicial, state, regional and local levels. Specific California and federal policy environment structures, processes and people will be examined for intended consequences, ethical dilemmas, social justice and equity issues.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Policy: Possibilities & Limitations of Educational Policy in a Democracy
edu.description: Course Description: Critically examine the democratic purposes of education in light of existing National, State, and local policy reform efforts. Questions include, "In what ways are these reforms and policies guided by democratic ideas and challenged by those ideals."
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Educational Finance, Human Resources, & Law; Human & Financial Assets; Allocations & Budgets
edu.description: Course Description: Topics include: education finance theory, contemporary finance policy issues, intergovernmental relations, effective resource management, budget analysis and preparation.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Educational Finance, Human Resources, & Law: Ethical & Legal Issues in Education
edu.description: Course Description: Human resource and legal concepts and activities governing decisions of school leaders in public education. Attention to theory, application, and practice of personnel and risk management, curriculum, student services, teacher rights, torts, student rights.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Educational Finance, Human Resources, & Law: Human Resources & Personnel
edu.description: Course Description: Human resource management research and theory and for applying human resource techniques in the educational setting.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Organizational Structures & Change: Data-Driven Decision-Making for Change
edu.description: Course Description: Use and examine multiple sources of information and data and trends found in making quality decisions to improve P-12/community college settings and addressing problems at sites. Learn limitations of these data sources.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Organizational Structures & Change: Curriculum & Instruction Issues in Education
edu.description: Course Description: Addresses the historical development of various curriculum and instructional methodologies found in public and private schools and colleges, and their impact on current curriculum development and reform efforts at the national, state and local level.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — CANDEL Dissertation Seminars
edu.description: Course Description: Third-year seminars encourage students to complete dissertations within the year. Cohort members meet together in every three-week meetings with faculty members and share their writing, data collection, analysis, discussion of results, development of conclusions/implications.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission into the CANDEL EdD program or consent of instructor.

edu.name: — CANDEL Dissertation
edu.description: Course Description: Cohort members continue to meet with faculty and share their writing, data collection, analysis, development of conclusions/implications.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor; passing of qualifying exams in CANDEL program and advancement to candidacy.

edu.name: — Inquiry & Practice: Academic Writing for Educational Leaders
edu.description: Course Description: Rigorous practice in the types of writing required of educational doctorate (CANDEL) students. Synthesizing literature as part of a literature review; crafting arguments using empirical and theoretical literature; and addressing implications of research as they relate to policy and practice.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Proseminar in Education
edu.description: Course Description: Professional induction into educational research field and Graduate Group in Education at UC Davis. Introduction to landscape of educational research methodologies, purposes and theories. Analysis of debates within field. Investigation of K-12 educational outreach efforts at UC Davis.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Admission to the M.A. or Ph.D. graduate program in Education.

edu.name: — Special Topics in Education
edu.description: Course Description: Selected topics in education. Designed to facilitate preparation for the qualifying examination or dissertation. Students will critically analyze scholarly work including their own works in progress.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Special Topics in Science, Agriculture & Mathematics Education
edu.description: Course Description: Critical study of special topics of research relevant to science, agricultural and mathematics education. Students and faculty present work-in-progress on a major research project, and critically analyze and discuss one another's developing scholarly work.

edu.name: — Special Topics in Learning & Mind Science
edu.description: Course Description: Critical study of selected issues in the learning sciences, neurodevelopmental disorders, and psychometrics and measurement, as they relate to education.

edu.name: — Group Study
edu.description: Course Description: Group study.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Individual Study
edu.description: Course Description: Individual study under the direction of a faculty member.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Research
edu.description: Course Description: Research for individual graduate students.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Reading in the Elementary School
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and curriculum materials for teaching of reading. Includes decoding skills with a special emphasis on phonics, comprehension skills, study skills, and reading in the content areas.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Reading in the Elementary School, Part A
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and curriculum materials for teaching of reading. Includes decoding skills with a special emphasis on phonics, comprehension skills, study skills, and reading in the content areas.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Reading in the Elementary Schools, Part B
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and curriculum materials for teaching of reading. Includes decoding skills with a special emphasis on phonics, comprehension skills, study skills, and reading in the content areas.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Reading in the Secondary School
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and materials to help secondary school teachers improve the reading competence of students. Strategies for enhancing learning through reading and writing in all disciplines, with special attention to linguistically diverse populations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching Literacy in High School Contexts
edu.description: Course Description: Focuses on secondary school literacy practices and strategies for engaging English-speaking and bilingual students with textual, image, and digital literacies across content areas. Covers reading and writing, the Common Core and Language Proficiency standards.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching Literacy in High School Contexts
edu.description: Course Description: Focuses on secondary school literacy practices and strategies for engaging English-speaking and bilingual students with textual, image, and digital literacies across content areas. Covers reading and writing, the Common Core and Language Proficiency standards.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Language Arts in the Elementary School
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and materials for the teaching of oral and written expression, listening skills, drama, and children's literature in elementary schools.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Art Education in the Elementary School
edu.description: Course Description: Understanding the principles of education in the arts through participation. Development of concepts, introduction to media, and techniques suitable for the elementary school with emphasis on cross-discipline exploration.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Elementary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular classrooms in elementary schools. Selection and organization of teaching materials. Introduction to techniques of diagnosing school achievement of children.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Elementary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular classrooms in elementary schools. Current conceptions of elementary school curriculum, emphasis on contributions from the social, biological, and physical sciences. Emphasis on effective teaching methods.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Elementary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular classrooms in elementary schools. Evaluation of teaching materials including instructional technology. Current elementary school curriculum with emphasis on contributions from fine arts and humanities.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Middle Grades
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular or special education classrooms in middle grades. Current conceptions of the middle-grades curriculum with emphasis on social, biological, and physical sciences. Effective teaching methods.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Secondary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular secondary classrooms. Techniques for classroom communications; constructing goals and objectives; assessment of learning; special problems of adolescents; instructional technology.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Secondary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular secondary classrooms. Techniques for classroom communications; constructing goals and objectives; assessment of learning; special problems of adolescents; instructional technology.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching in the Secondary Schools
edu.description: Course Description: Supervised teaching in regular secondary classrooms. Techniques for classroom communications; constructing goals and objectives; assessment of learning; special problems of adolescents; instructional technology.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Methods in Elementary Science
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and materials for teaching the biological and physical sciences in elementary schools.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Methods in Elementary Social Studies
edu.description: Course Description: Principles, procedures, and materials for teaching history and the social sciences in elementary schools.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — The Teaching of Mathematics, K-9
edu.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum and teaching methods for K-9 reflecting the needs of California's diverse student populations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — The Teaching of Mathematics, K–9, Part A
edu.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum and teaching methods for K–9 reflecting the needs of California's diverse student populations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — The Teaching of Mathematics, K–9, Part B
edu.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum and teaching methods for K–9 reflecting the needs of California's diverse student populations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching as Reflective Practice
edu.description: Course Description: Presentation of issues related to classroom instruction and professional practice, reflections on classroom instruction and other documentation related to student teaching experience.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Creating Classroom Communities
edu.description: Course Description: Observation of classrooms at beginning of academic year for first-hand experience with teachers’ approaches to creating communities and setting routines. Candidates are placed with students they will teach during student teaching. Candidates may take on teaching tasks as appropriate.

edu.name: — Pedagogical Preparation for Secondary Social Science  I
edu.description: Course Description: Introduction to teaching methods and curriculum approaches for secondary social science teaching. State and national curriculum standards; application of learning theory to effective instruction; interdisciplinary teaching and active learning approaches; effective teaching strategies for English learners.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Pedagogical Preparation for Secondary Social Science II
edu.description: Course Description: Intermediate teaching methods and curriculum approaches for secondary social science teaching. Interdisciplinary approaches to teaching major themes across social science content areas; teaching potentially controversial social science topics; teaching democratic civic values, student assessment and evaluation.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Physical Science in the Secondary School
edu.description: Course Description: Activity-based overview of concepts and processes in secondary school physical sciences. Emphasis upon philosophy, appropriate teaching methods, materials, assessment and evaluation of learning.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Life Sciences in the Secondary School
edu.description: Course Description: Activity-based overview of concepts and processes in secondary school biology and life sciences. Emphasis on philosophy, appropriate teaching methods, materials, assessment and evaluation of learning, and issues.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Methods & Technology in Secondary Mathematics I
edu.description: Course Description: Introduction to methods and curriculum for teaching mathematics at the secondary level. Introduction to applications of computer technology as instructional, intellectual, and communication tools for mathematics teachers.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Methods in Secondary Mathematics II
edu.description: Course Description: Expansion of methods and curriculum for teaching mathematics at the secondary level. Intermediate applications of computer technology as instructional, intellectual, and communication tools in mathematics teaching.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Research & Methods in Secondary English Language Arts
edu.description: Course Description: Research on teaching and learning in the language arts. Principles, procedures and materials for improving the writing, reading and oral language of secondary students, with special attention to students from culturally and linguistically diverse populations.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching Language Minority Students in Secondary Schools: Methods & Research
edu.description: Course Description: Research on principles, procedures and curricula for teaching discipline-specific concepts to language-minority students in secondary schools. Second-language acquisition principles and instructional strategies.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching Methods for Secondary Foreign Language/Spanish, Part I
edu.description: Course Description: Introduction to methods for teaching Spanish as a foreign and a heritage language in secondary schools. State and National Standards. Theories on second language acquisition. Lesson plans. Effective teaching strategies and class management.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Teaching Methods for Secondary Foreign Language/Spanish, Part II
edu.description: Course Description: Continuation to methods for teaching Spanish as a foreign and a heritage language in secondary schools. Research and practice on foreign and heritage language teaching. Expansion of effective teaching strategies and class management.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance in Teacher Credential Program.

edu.name: — Active Literacy Academyo—The UK Experience
edu.description: Course Description: One-week introduction to the teaching of dense text for teachers of grades K-12. Examination of Shakespeare’s canon and immersion in active classroom practices that deepen engagement and understanding of key themes that transcend content areas.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of Instructor; consent of instructor based on selection/application process of participants.

edu.name: — Group Study
edu.description: Course Description: Group study.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

edu.name: — Individual Study
edu.description: Course Description: Individual study.
edu.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

eap.name: — Global Thinking
eap.description: Course Description: Global perspectives on challenges facing our planet and humanity in historical and contemporary contexts. Understanding transnational systems’ impacts and roles in generating equitable solutions. Global diversity and global action on climate, migration, public health, food/water, inequality, and more.

eap.name: — International Education Seminar
eap.description: Course Description: Seminar examines the academic, cultural, and personal issues of study abroad, including academic programs abroad, country-specific history and culture, cross-cultural experiences, culture shock, racial and gender issues.
eap.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Open to lower division applicants for EAP or UC Davis study abroad and international internship programs.

eap.name: — Education Abroad: Special Topics
eap.description: Course Description: Students who participate in approved international programs take this course up to 12 units while studying abroad.
eap.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Minimum GPA requirement for each study abroad program as specified in the written agreement between UC Davis and the host institution; prerequisites for language courses may also apply.

eap.name: — International Education Seminar
eap.description: Course Description: Seminar examines the academic, cultural, and personal issues of study abroad, including academic programs abroad, country-specific history and culture, cross-cultural experiences, culture shock, racial and gender issues.
eap.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Open to upper division applicants for EAP or UC Davis study abroad and international internship programs.

eap.name: — Internship in Education Abroad
eap.description: Course Description: Internship with Education Abroad program, potentially either at university or taught abroad.
eap.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Participation in a study abroad program.

eec.name: — Introduction to Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Introduction to Electrical & Computer Engineering with focus on sub-disciplines of Electrical & Computer Engineering, engineering design, and problem solving. Microcontrollers, analog circuits, signal processing, and communications links. Application of topics to create a functional device.

eec.name: — Introduction to Programming & Microcontrollers
eec.description: Course Description: Programming computers using C/C++ languages. Software engineering and object-oriented design. Programming for hardware devices.

eec.name: — Introduction to Digital & Analog Systems
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Interactive and practical introduction to fundamental concepts of electrical and computer engineering by implementing electronic systems, which can be digitally controlled and interrogated, with a programmable microcontroller with the ability to program the electrical connections between analog and digital components.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (PHY 009C (can be concurrent) or PHY 009HD (can be concurrent)); (ECS 030 or ECS 036B or EEC 007); ENG 017; consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Digital Systems I
eec.description: Course Description: Introduction to digital system design including combinational logic design, sequential and asynchronous circuits, computer arithmetic, memory systems and algorithmic state machine design; computer aided design (CAD) methodologies and tools.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Electromagnetics
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Electromagnetics.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Physical Electronics
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Physical Electronics.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Active & Passive Circuits
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Active & Passive Circuits.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Signals & Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Signals & Systems.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Computer Systems & Software
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Computer Systems & Software.

eec.name: — Special Topics in Digital System Design
eec.description: Course Description: Special topics in Digital System Design.

eec.name: — Research Group Conference in Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: Course Description: Research group conferences.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Lower division standing.

eec.name: — Lower Division Seminar
eec.description: Course Description: Examination of a special topic in a small group setting.

eec.name: — Internship in Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: Course Description: Supervised work experience in Electrical & Computer Engineering.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Lower division standing; project approval prior to period of internship.

eec.name: — Directed Group Study
eec.description: Course Description: Directed group study.

eec.name: — Special Study for Lower Division Students
eec.description: Course Description: Special study for lower division students.

eec.name: — Circuits II
eec.description: Course Description: Theory, application, and design of analog circuits. Methods of analysis including frequency response, SPICE simulation, and Laplace transform. Operational amplifiers and design of active filters.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 017 C- or better; (MAT 022B or MAT 027B).

eec.name: — EE-Emerge 1
eec.description: Course Description: Work in groups to conceive, design and prototype electronic exhibits to promote engineering to the public.

eec.name: — EE-Emerge 2
eec.description: Course Description: Work in groups to construct electronic exhibits.

eec.name: — EE-Emerge 3
eec.description: Course Description: Work in groups to present electronic exhibits to the public.

eec.name: — Electronic Circuits I
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Use and modeling of nonlinear solid-state electronic devices in basic analog and digital circuits. Introduction to the design of transistor amplifiers and logic gates.

eec.name: — Electronic Circuits II
eec.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of integrated circuits. Single-stage amplifiers, cascaded amplifier stages, differential amplifiers, current sources, frequency response, and return-ratio analysis of feedback amplifiers.

eec.name: — Digital Electronic Circuits
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: MOS device fundamentals, introduction to the design of CMOS logic gates, layout, circuits, and modeling. Examination of voltage transfer characteristics, and propagation delay.

eec.name: — Communication Electronics
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Electronic circuits for analog and digital communication, including oscillators, mixers, tuned amplifiers, modulators, demodulators, and phase-locked loops. Circuits for amplitude modulation (AM) and frequency modulation (FM) are emphasized.

eec.name: — Power Electronic Circuits
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Electronic circuits for power applications, including linear voltage regulators, switching DC-DC converters, DC-AC converters (inverters) and AC-DC converters (rectifiers). Control loop and stability of circuits.

eec.name: — VLSI Design
eec.description: Course Description: CMOS devices, layout, circuits, and functional units; VLSI fabrication and design methodologies.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 110A or EEC 111; EEC 018 or 180A recommended.

eec.name: — Digital Integrated Circuits
eec.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of digital integrated circuits. Emphasis on MOS logic circuit families. Logic gate construction, voltage transfer characteristics, propagation delay, and power consumption. Regenerative circuits, sequential elements, interconnect, RAMs, ROMs, and PLAs.

eec.name: — Integrated Circuit Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Design course involving architecture, circuit design, physical design, and validation through extensive simulation of a digital or mixed-signal integrated circuit of substantial complexity under given design constraints. Team project that includes a final report.

eec.name: — Integrated Circuit Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Design course involving architecture, circuit design, physical design, and validation through extensive simulation of a digital or mixed-signal integrated circuit of substantial complexity under given design constraints. Team project that includes a final report.

eec.name: — Electromagnetics I
eec.description: Course Description: Basics of static electric and magnetic fields and fields in materials. Work and scalar potential. Maxwell's equations in integral and differential form. Plan waves in lossless media. Lossless transmission lines.

eec.name: — Introductory Electromagnetics II
eec.description: Course Description: Plane wave propagation in lossy media, reflections, guided waves, simple modulated waves and dispersion, and basic antennas.

eec.name: — RF & Microwaves in Wireless Communication
eec.description: Course Description: Study of Radio Frequency and Microwave theory and practice for design of wireless electronic systems. Transmission lines, microwave integrated circuits, circuit analyis of electromagnetic energy transfer systems, the scattering parameters.

eec.name: — RF & Microwaves in Wireless Communication
eec.description: Course Description: Passive RF and microwave device analysis, design, fabrication, and testing for wireless applications. RF and microwave filter and coupler design. Introductory analysis and design of RF and microwave transistor amplifiers.

eec.name: — RF & Microwaves in Wireless Communications
eec.description: Course Description: RF and microwave amplifier theory and design, including transistor circuit models, stability considerations, noise models and low noise design. Theory and design of microwave transistor oscillators and mixers. Wireless system design and analysis.

eec.name: — Electromagnetic Radiation & Antenna Analysis
eec.description: Course Description: Properties of electromagnetic radiation; analysis and design of antennas: ideal, small loop, aperture, and arrays; antenna simulations/measurements.

eec.name: — RF/Microwave Systems Design
eec.description: Course Description: Board-level RF design, fabrication, and characterization of an RF/microwave system, including the antenna, RF front-end, baseband, mix-signal circuits, and digital signal processing models.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 130B or EEC 110B or EEC 150A.

eec.name: — RF/Microwave Systems Design
eec.description: Course Description: Board-level RF design, fabrication, and characterization of an RF/microwave system, including the antenna, RF front-end, baseband, mix-signal circuits, and digital signal processing models.

eec.name: — Optoelectronics for High-Speed Data Networking & Computing Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Principles of optical communication systems. Planar dielectric waveguides. Optical fibers. Silicon photonics. Attenuation and dispersion in optical fibers. Optical sources, detectors, transmitters, receivers, modulators, optical amplifiers, and optical multiplexers/demultiplexers. Optics in data centers and computing systems. Design of digital optical communication links.

eec.name: — Electronic Design Project
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Optical, electronic and communication-engineering design of an opto-electronic system operating under performance and economic constraints. Measurement techniques will be designed and implemented, and the system will be characterized.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ECS 036B or EEC 007); EEC 018; EEC 100; (EEC 110B or EEC 180 or EEC 157A (can be concurrent)).

eec.name: — Electronic Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Optical, electronic and communication-engineering design of an opto-electronic system operating under performance and economic constraints. Measurement techniques will be designed and implemented, and the system will be characterized.

eec.name: — Principles of Device Physics I
eec.description: Course Description: Semiconductor device fundamentals, equilibrium and non-equilibrium statistical mechanics, conductivity, diffusion, electrons and holes, p-n and Schottky junctions, first-order metal-oxide-semiconductor (MOS) field effect transistors, bipolar junction transistor fundamentals.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 017 (can be concurrent); (PHY 009D or PHY 009HE).

eec.name: — Principles of Device Physics I
eec.description: Course Description: Semiconductor device fundamentals, equilibrium and non-equilibrium statistical mechanics, conductivity, diffusion, electrons and holes, p-n and Schottky junctions, first-order metal-oxide-semiconductor (MOS) field effect transistors, bipolar junction transistor fundamentals.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 017 (can be concurrent); (PHY 009D or PHY 009HE).

eec.name: — Principles of Device Physics II
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Electrical properties, designs, models and advanced concepts for MOS, Bipolar, and Junction Field-Effect Transistors, including scaling, minority-carrier distributions, non-ideal effects, and device fabrication methods. MESFET and heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs). Fundamentals of solar cells, photodetectors, LEDs and semiconductor lasers.

eec.name: — Electronic Materials
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Electronic and physical properties of materials used in electronics, ICs, optoelectronics and MEMS. Semiconductors, dielectrics, metals, optical materials, organic semiconductive, optical and nonlinear properties, as well as their synthesis and deposition methods.

eec.name: — Integrated Circuits Fabrication
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Theoretical and experimental study of basic fabrication processes for metal oxide semiconductor integrated circuits, including oxidation, photolithography, impurity diffusion, metallization, wet chemical etching, and characterization.

eec.name: — Advanced Integrated Circuits Fabrication
eec.description: Course Description: Fabrication processes for CMOS VLSI. Laboratory projects examine deposition of thin films, ion implantation, process simulation, anisotropic plasma etching, sputter metallization, and C-V analysis. Topics include isolation, projection alignment, epilayer growth, thin gate oxidation, and rapid thermal annealing.

eec.name: —  Introduction to Signals & Systems
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Characterization and analysis of continuous-time linear systems. Fourier series and transforms with applications. Introduction to communication systems. Transfer functions and block diagrams. Elements of feedback systems. Stability of linear systems.

eec.name: — Digital Signals & Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Characterization and analysis of discrete time systems. Difference equation models. Z-transform analysis methods. Frequency Analysis. Discrete and fast Fourier transforms. Digital Filtering.

eec.name: — Digital Signal Processing
eec.description: Course Description: Theory and practice of real-time digital signal processing. Fundamentals of real-time systems. Programmable architectures including I/O, memory, peripherals, interrupts, DMA. Interfacing issues with A/D and D/A converters to a programmable DSP. Specification driven design and implementation of simple DSP applications.

eec.name: — Control Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of feedback control systems. Examples are drawn from electrical and mechanical systems as well as other engineering fields. Mathematical modeling of systems, stability criteria, root-locus and frequency domain design methods.

eec.name: — Control Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of feedback control systems. Examples drawn from electrical and mechanical systems as well as other engineering fields. Mathematical modeling of systems, stability criteria, root-locus and frequency domain design methods.

eec.name: — Control Systems
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Control system design; transfer-function and state-space methods; sampled-data implementation, digital control. Laboratory includes feedback system experiments and simulation studies.

eec.name: — Control Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Control system design; transfer-function and state-space methods; sampled-data implementation, digital control. Laboratory includes feedback system experiments and simulation studies.

eec.name: — Signal Analysis & Communications
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Signal analysis based on Fourier methods. Fourier series and transforms; time-sampling, convolution, and filtering; spectral density; modulation: carrier-amplitude, carrier-frequency, and pulse-amplitude.

eec.name: — Probabilistic Analysis of Electrical & Computer Systems
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Probabilistic and statistical analysis of electrical and computer systems. Discrete and continuous random variables, expectation and moments. Transformation of random variables. Joint and conditional densities. Limit theorems and statistics. Noise models, system reliability and testing.

eec.name: — Statistical & Digital Communication
eec.description: Course Description: Introduction to random process models of modulated signals and noise, and analysis of receiver performance. Analog and digitally modulated signals. Signal-to-noise ratio, probability of error, matched filters. Intersymbol interference, pulse shaping and equalization. Carrier and clock synchronization.

eec.name: — Introduction to Computer Architecture
eec.description: Course Description: Introduces basic aspects of computer architecture, including computer performance measurement, instruction set design, computer arithmetic, pipelined/non-pipelined implementation, and memory hierarchies (cache and virtual memory). Presents a simplified Reduced Instruction Set Computer using logic design methods from the prerequisite course.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ECS 036B or ECS 030 or ECS 034 or EEC 007); (EEC 018 or EEC 180A).

eec.name: — Parallel Computer Architecture
eec.description: Course Description: Organization and design of parallel processors including shared-memory multiprocessors, cache coherence, memory consistency, snooping protocols, synchronization, scalable multiprocessors, message passing protocols, distributed shared memory and interconnection networks.

eec.name: — Embedded Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Introduction to embedded-system hardware and software. Topics include: embedded processor and memory architecture; input/output hardware and software, including interrupts and direct memory access; interfacing with sensors and actuators; wired and wireless embedded networking.

eec.name: — Computer Networks
eec.description: Course Description: Overview of computer networks, TCP/IP protocol suite, computer-networking applications and protocols, transport-layer protocols, network architectures, Internet Protocol (IP), routing, link-layer protocols, local area and wireless networks, medium access control, physical aspects of data transmission, and network-performance analysis.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ECS 060 or ECS 032B or ECS 036C); (ECS 132 or EEC 161 or MAT 135A or STA 131A or STA 120 or STA 032).

eec.name: — Advanced Topics in Computer Networks
eec.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in computer networks, wireless networks, multimedia networking, traffic analysis and modeling, network design and management, network simulation and performance analysis, and design projects in communication networks.

eec.name: — Applied Machine Learning
eec.description: Course Description: Applied machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) in engineering systems. Design and evaluation of components that are critical to artificial intelligence (AI) driven control systems, including but not limited to sensor fusion, feature engineering, computer vision (semantic segmentation, objection detection), ML based classification, and learning-based control systems. Team project including a final presentation and report.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 006 or MAT 022AL); (EEC 007 or ECS 036B); (EEC 161 or EEC 151 or ECS 036C).

eec.name: — Applied Machine Learning Senior Design Projects
eec.description: Course Description: Design, development, and evaluation of components that are critical to artificial intelligence (AI) driven control systems. Team project including a final presentation and report. Example design themes include but not limited to self-driving cars, smart healthcare, and precision agriculture.

eec.name: — Internet of Things
eec.description: Course Description: Introduction to principles, technologies, challenges, and required expertise to build the Internet of Things (IoT) solutions. Sensing, computing, wireless communication, IP communication, and cloud processing for building an IoT solution.

eec.name: — Internet of Things Senior Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Propose and design a senior IoT design project, using the design principles they have studied in the prerequisite course, Internet of Things.

eec.name: — Digital Systems II
eec.description: Course Description: Computer-aided design of digital systems with emphasis on hardware description languages (VHDL), logic synthesis, and field-programmable gate arrays (FPGA). May cover advanced topics in digital system design such as static timing analysis, pipelining, memory system design, testing digital circuits.

eec.name: — Digital Systems Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Digital-system and computer-engineering design course involving architecture, design, implementation and testing of a prototype application-specific processor under given design constraints. Team project includes a final presentation and report.

eec.name: — Digital Systems Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Digital-system and computer-engineering design course involving architecture, design, implementation and testing of a prototype application-specific processor under given design constraints. Team project includes a final presentation and report.

eec.name: — Testing & Verification of Digital Systems
eec.description: Course Description: Computer aided-testing and design verification techniques for digital systems; physical fault testing; simulation-based design verification; formal verification; timing analysis.

eec.name: — Research Group Conferences in Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: Course Description: Research group conferences.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Upper division standing in Electrical and Computer Engineering.

eec.name: — Internship in Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: Course Description: Supervised work experience in electrical and computer engineering.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Completion of a minimum of 84 units; project approval before period of internship.

eec.name: — Senior Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Team design project for seniors in Electrical or Computer Engineering. Project involves analysis, design, implementation and evaluation of an Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering system. Project is supervised by a faculty member.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 196 (can be concurrent); and consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Senior Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Team design project for seniors in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering. Project involves analysis, design, implementation and evaluation of an Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering system. Project supervised by a faculty member.

eec.name: — Autonomous Vehicle Design Project
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Design and construct an autonomous race car. Work in groups to design, build and test speed control circuits, track sensing circuits, and a steering control loop.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ECS 036A or EEC 007); EEC 018; (EEC 110B or EEC 157A (can be concurrent) or ECS 036B).

eec.name: — Autonomous Vehicle Design Project
eec.description: Course Description: Design and construct an autonomous race car. Students work in groups to design, build and test speed control circuits, track sensing circuits, and a steering control loop.

eec.name: — Issues in Engineering Design
eec.description: Course Description: Covers various electrical and computer engineering standards and realistic design constraints including economic, manufacturability, sustainability, ethical, health & safety, environmental, social, and political.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Senior standing in Electrical or Computer Engineering.

eec.name: — Tutoring in Electrical & Computer Engineering
eec.description: Course Description: Tutoring in Electrical & Computer Engineering courses, especially introductory circuits. For upper division undergraduate students who will provide tutorial assistance.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Upper division standing.

eec.name: — Directed Group Study
eec.description: Course Description: Directed group study.

eec.name: — Special Study for Advanced Undergraduates
eec.description: Course Description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

eec.name: — Navigating Graduate School
eec.description: Course Description: Practical and non-technical skills necessary for first-year students in the Electrical & Computer Engineering Graduate Group. Mentorship, time management, research ethics, science communication, intellectual property.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year Electrical  Computer Engineering graduate student, Electrical  Computer Engineering transfer student, or instructor approval.

eec.name: — Digital Signal Processing
eec.description: Course Description: Theory and design of digital filters. Classification of digital filters, linear phase systems, all-pass functions, FIR and IIR filter design methods and optimality measures, numerically robust structures for digital filters.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 150B; STA 120 or MAT 131 or MAT 167 recommended.

eec.name: — Computational Methods in Biomedical Imaging
eec.description: Course Description: Analytic tomographic reconstruction from projections in 2D and 3D; model-based image reconstruction methods; maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods; applications to CT, PET, and SPECT.

eec.name: — Digital Image Processing
eec.description: Course Description: Two-dimensional systems theory, image perception, sampling and quantization, transform theory and applications, enhancement, filtering and restoration, image analysis, and image processing systems.

eec.name: — MOS Analog Circuit Design
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Analysis and design of MOS amplifiers, bias circuits, voltage references and other analog circuits. Stability and compensation of feedback amplifiers. Introduction to noise analysis in MOS circuits.

eec.name: — Advanced Analog Circuit Design
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Noise and distortion in electronic circuits and systems. Application to communication circuits. Specific applications include mixers, low-noise amplifiers, power amplifiers, phase-locked loops, oscillators and receiver architectures.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 210; STA 131A and EEC 112 recommended.

eec.name: — Analog MOS IC Design for Signal Processing
eec.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of analog MOS integrated circuits. Passive components, Single-ended and fully differential op amps, Sampled-data and continuous-time filters.

eec.name: — Data-Conversion Techniques & Circuits
eec.description: Course Description: Digital-to-analog and analog-to-digital conversion; component characteristics and matching; sample-and-hold, comparator, amplifier, and reference circuits.

eec.name: — Integrated Circuit Design for Power Electronics
eec.description: Course Description: IC design for power electronics. Linear and switching regulation. Integrated power management. DC/DC and AC/DC conversion. Applications in portable electronics and wireless sensors.

eec.name: — Circuits for Digital Communications
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Analog, digital, and mixed-signal CMOS implementations of communication-circuit blocks: gain control, adaptive equalizers, sampling detectors, clock recovery.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 150B; EEC 210 (can be concurrent); EEC 165, EEC 166, or EEC 265 recommended.

eec.name: — Low Power Digital Integrated Circuit Design
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Integrated circuit design for low power and energy consumption. Low power architectures, logic styles and circuit design. Variable supply and threshold voltages. Leakage management. Power estimation. Energy sources, power electronics, and energy recovery. Applications in portable electronics and sensors. Thermodynamic limits.

eec.name: — Radio Frequency & Microwave Filter Design
eec.description: Course Description: Design of radio frequency and microwave filters including filter specification and approximation theory. Passive LC filter design covers doubly-terminated reactance two-port synthesis and coupling matrix based synthesis. Active filter design includes sensitivity, op-amp building blocks, and cascade filter design.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 132A; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — RF IC Design
eec.description: Course Description: Radio frequency (RF) solid-state devices, RF device modeling and design rules; non-linear RF circuit design techniques; use of non-linear computer-aided (CAD) tools; RF power amplifier design.

eec.name: — RF Integrated Circuits for Wireless Communications
eec.description: Course Description: Integrated RF front end circuit design of receivers and synthesizers for wireless communications, such as LNA, mixers, PLL; noise and linearity analysis and specifications; theory and working mechanism of synthesizers and phase noise analysis.

eec.name: — Terahertz & mm-Wave Integrated Circuit Design
eec.description: Course Description: Fundamental theory of RF transmitter and receiver, including noise analysis, transceiver architectures, and antenna arrays. Fundamental limitations, theory and design of amplifiers, oscillators and signal sources at THz and mm-wave frequencies.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 132A; EEC 112; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Advanced Microwave Circuit & Device Design Techniques
eec.description: Course Description: Theory, design, fabrication, analysis of advanced microwave circuits and devices. Wideband transformers, stripline/microstripline broadband couplers. Lumped and distributed filter synthesis. Broadband matching theory applied to microwave devices. Wideband and low noise FET/HEMT amplifiers. Advanced microwave oscillator theory. Phase noise analysis.

eec.name: — RF-MEMS & Adaptive Wireless Frontends
eec.description: Course Description: Focuses on the modeling, design, fabrication, and characterization of RF-MEMS while providing a thorough introduction to the technology with an emphasis on how it will benefit the design of adaptive RF/microwave wireless systems.

eec.name: — Electromagnetics
eec.description: Course Description: Maxwell's equations, plane waves, reflection and refraction, complex waves, waveguides, resonant cavities, and basic antennas.

eec.name: — Plasma Physics & Controlled Fusion I
eec.description: Course Description: Equilibrium plasma properties; single particle motion; fluid equations; waves & instabilities in a fluid plasma; plasma kinetic theory & transport coefficients; linear & nonlinear Vlasov theory; fluctuations, correlations & radiation; inertial & magnetic confinement systems in controlled fusion.

eec.name: — Plasma Physics & Controlled Fusion II
eec.description: Course Description: Equilibrium plasma properties; single particle motion; fluid equations; waves & instabilities in a fluid plasma; plasma kinetic theory & transport coefficients; linear & nonlinear Vlasov theory; fluctuations, correlations & radiation; inertial & magnetic confinement systems in controlled fusion.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 231A; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Plasma Physics & Controlled Fusion III
eec.description: Course Description: Equilibrium plasma properties; single particle motion; fluid equations; waves & instabilities in a fluid plasma; plasma kinetic theory & transport coefficients; linear & nonlinear Vlasov theory; fluctuations, correlations & radiation; inertial & magnetic confinement systems in controlled fusion.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 231B; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Advanced Applied Electromagnetics I
eec.description: Course Description: The exact formulation of applied electromagnetic problems using Green's functions. Applications of these techniques to transmission circuits.

eec.name: — Advanced Applied Electromagnetics II
eec.description: Course Description: An advanced treatment of electromagnetics with applications to passive microwave devices and antennas.

eec.name: — High Speed Signal Integrity
eec.description: Course Description: Design and analysis of interconnects in high-speed circuits and sub-systems; understanding of high-speed signal propagation and signal integrity concepts; electromagnetic modeling tools and experimental techniques.

eec.name: — Physics & Technology of Microwave Vacuum Electron Beam Devices I
eec.description: Course Description: Physics & technology of electron beam emission, flow and transport, electron gun design, space charge waves & klystrons with applications to accelerator systems, RF power sources for radar & communication systems, thermionic energy conversion, and electric space propulsion. Recent advances in materials & manufacturing technologies are also reviewed.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): B.S. degree in physics or engineering or the equivalent background or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Physics & Technology of Microwave Vacuum Electron Beam Devices II
eec.description: Course Description: Theory, modeling, & experimental design of traveling wave tubes, backward wave oscillators, and extended interaction oscillators employed in satellite commutations, plasma imaging, and underground imaging systems.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 234A; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Physics & Technology of Microwave Vacuum Electron Beam Devices III
eec.description: Course Description: Physics & technology of gyrotrons, gyro-amplifiers, free electron lasers, magnetrons, cross-field amplifiers, and relativistic devices employed in plasma fusion reactors, microwave heating, and high power microwave applications.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 234B; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Photonics
eec.description: Course Description: Optical propagation of electromagnetic waves and beams in photonic components and the design of such devices using numerical techniques.

eec.name: — Nonlinear Optical Applications
eec.description: Course Description: Nonlinear optical interactions in optical communication, optical information processing and integrated optics. Basic concepts underlying optical nonlinear interactions in materials and guided media.

eec.name: — Lasers
eec.description: Course Description: Theoretical and practical description of lasers. Theory of population inversion, amplification and oscillation using semiclassical oscillator model and rate equations. Description and design of real laser system.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 235; EEC 130B; or the equivalent of EEC 130B.

eec.name: — Laser Physics II
eec.description: Course Description: Oscillation threshold. Coupled cavity/atomic rate equations, Linear pulse propagation; dispersion, broadening, compression. Nonlinear pulse propagation. Energy extraction. Optical beams, resonators, eigenmodes, axial/transverse modes. Paraxial ray optics, resonator stability, ABCD matrices. Laser dynamics; transients, spiking, Q-switching, active and passive modelocking.

eec.name: — Semiconductor Lasers & Photonic Integration
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Understanding of fundamental optical transitions in semiconductors and quantum-confined systems are applied to diode & unipolar lasers and selected photonic devices. The importance of radiative and non-radiative recombination, simulated emission, excitons in quantum wells, and strained quantum layers are considered. Photonic integrated circuits based on active (with optical gain) and passive (without optical gain).

eec.name: — Optical Communication Technologies  for High-Speed Data Networking
eec.description: Course Description: Enabling technologies for optical fiber communication and data center networks. Physical layer issues for component and system technologies in high-speed data optical communications. High-capacity data multiplexing technologies including wavelength-division-multiplexing, time-division-multiplexing, and advanced coherent modulation. Optical signal transmission, optical amplification, and optical switching for telecom and data center networks.

eec.name: — High-Capacity Optical Data Systems & Networks
eec.description: Course Description: High-capacity optical data systems and networks, built-on modern optical communication technologies. Technologies behind data center networking, software defined networking, and RF-optical networking. Physical layer issues in light of networking architectures and protocols. Optical communications systems design and integration. Systems technologies and higher-level network architecture, case studies. WDM, TDM, and EON networking, optical and wireless access technologies based on PON and ROF.

eec.name: — Semiconductor Device Physics
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Physical principles, characteristics and models of fundamental semiconductor device types, including P-N and Schottky diodes, MOSFETs and MESFETs Bipolar Junction Transistors, and light emitters/detectors.

eec.name: — Introduction to Molecular Electronics
eec.description: Course Description: Examines molecules for electronic devices and sensors. Covers: electronic states of molecules, charge transport in nanoscale systems, and fabrication and measurement of molecular-scale devices. Specific Topics: Hartree-Fock & Density Functional Theory, Landauer formalism, coulomb blockade, tunneling and hopping transport.

eec.name: — Advanced Nanostructured Devices
eec.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Physics of nano-structured materials and device operation. Overview of new devices enabled by nanotechnology; fabrication and characterization methods; applications of nano-structures and devices.

eec.name: — Optical Imaging & Microscopy
eec.description: Course Description: Theory and techniques of optical imaging & microscopy. Fourier optics; light propagation & light detection; imaging contrast mechanisms; optical & microscopy techniques.

eec.name: — Introduction to Neuroengineering
eec.description: Course Description: Survey of neuroengineering field from engineering and biological perspectives; micro-/nano-fabrication technology; optical and electrical techniques to monitor and modulate neural activity; computational tools and control systems; prosthetics and human machine interfaces; human performance and rehabilitation; cognitive neuroengineering; neuroethics; extensive proposal development to merge aforementioned themes into a multidisciplinary project.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing; or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Micro- & Nano-Technology in Life Sciences
eec.description: Course Description: Survey of biodevice design from engineering and biological perspectives; micro-/nano-fabrication techniques; surface science and mass transport; essential biological processes and models; proposal development skills on merging aforementioned themes.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or consent of instructor.

eec.name: — Advanced Projects in IC Fabrication
eec.description: Course Description: Individualized projects in the fabrication of analog or digital integrated electronic or optoelectronic circuits.

eec.name: — Advanced Semiconductor Devices
eec.description: Course Description: Semiconductor devices, including MOSFETs, heterojunction transistors, light-emitting diodes, lasers, sensors, detectors, power and high-voltage transistors, MEMS resonators, organic semiconductors and photovoltaics. All material is from recent literature, encouraging students to utilize search methods and critically assess the latest research.

eec.name: — Photovoltaics & Solar Cells
eec.description: Course Description: Physics and application of photovoltaics and solar cells, including design, fabrication technology, and grid incorporation. Mono and microcrystalline silicon devices; thin-film technologies, heterojunction and organic-semiconductor technologies. Collectors, electrical inverters and infrastructure issues. Challenges and concerns.
eec.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EEC 140B; or consent of instructor, or equivalent.

eec.name: — Nanofabrication
eec.description: Course Description: Theory and practice of nanofabrication (top-down and bottom-up approaches), used for producing integrated circuits, electronic devices, sensors, and microstructures. Process development and characterization.

eec.name: — Linear Systems & Signals
eec.description: Course Description: Mathematical description of systems. Selected topics in linear algebra.
