mgt.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, finance and workplace processes.

mgt.name: — Topics in Management
mgt.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, and workplace processes.

mgt.name: — Topics in General Management
mgt.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in MGT 201A and MGT 201B, or current business interest topics in fields of business writing, business communications, development, or workplace processes.

mgt.name: — Topics in Finance
mgt.description: Course Description: Contemporary and emerging issues in finance. Application of modern techniques of finance to business problems. Use of appropriate electronic database and research techniques.

mgt.name: — Topics in Marketing
mgt.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in marketing, which may include marketing research, new product development, brand management, pricing, distribution management, service marketing, hi-tech marketing, advertising, sales promotions, marketing through the Web.

mgt.name: — Directed Group Study Management Practicum
mgt.description: Course Description: Provides the opportunity for students to gain experience in applying business methodologies previously acquired in other GSM courses.
mgt.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Sponsorship of a GSM Academic Senate faculty member, and approval of graduate advisor.

mgt.name: — Directed Individual Study Management Practicum
mgt.description: Course Description: Provides the opportunity for students to gain experience in applying business methodologies previously acquired in other Graduate School of Management courses.
mgt.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Sponsorship of a Graduate School of Management Academic Senate faculty member and approval of graduate advisor.

mgv.name: — Financial Accounting
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to the concepts and objectives underlying the preparation of financial statements. Topics include understanding the accounting cycle, measurement and valuation problems associated with financial statement components, consideration of the usefulness of financial statements in the analysis of a corporation’s operations.

mgv.name: — Managerial Accounting
mgv.description: Course Description: Information managers should know to be effective, including: product costing, motivating people, and differential analysis for decision making. Includes team projects and written and oral presentations.

mgv.name: — The Individual & Group Dynamics
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines basic psychological and social psychological processes shaping human behavior and applies knowledge of these processes to the following organizational problems: motivation, job design, commitment, socialization, culture, individual and group decision making, and team building.

mgv.name: — Organizational Strategy & Structure
mgv.description: Course Description: Strategic management of organizations, including analysis of industries, firm resources and capabilities and corporate strategy. Strategy formulation, implementation and strategic decision-making. Firm and industry life cycles and change. Analysis of organizational design and structure including differentiation and integration.

mgv.name: — Markets & the Firm
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines the interaction of consumers, firms and government, and the effect this interaction has on the use of resources and firm profitability. Fundamental economic concepts such as marginal analysis, opportunity cost, pricing, and externalities are introduced and applied.

mgv.name: — Data Analysis for Managers
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to statistics and data analysis for managerial decision making. Descriptive statistics, principles of data collection, sampling, quality control, statistical inference. Application of data analytic methods to problems in marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.

mgv.name: — Forecasting & Managerial Research Methods
mgv.description: Course Description: Influence of government and international factors on business. Distribution of income, business cycles, inflation and interest rates, the federal debt, monetary policy and international trade and finance.

mgv.name: — Marketing Management
mgv.description: Course Description: Analysis of market opportunities, elements of market research, development of marketing strategies, market planning and implementations, and control systems. Consumer and industrial markets, market segmentation, pricing strategies, distribution channels, promotion, and sales.

mgv.name: — Financial Theory & Policy
mgv.description: Course Description: Corporate financial policy and investment management. Covers capital budgeting, optimal financial structure, cost-of-capital determination, risk measurement. Develops basic valuation principles for investments with long-lived and risky cash-flows, and extends these to derivative securities, asset portfolios, investment management and hedging.

mgv.name: — Decision Analytics
mgv.description: Course Description: Develops decision-making and problem-solving skills in conjunction with a quantitative model-building approach. Emphasis on how structured modeling techniques, probability forecasts, simulations, and computer optimization models are used in the overall process of making decisions in an uncertain environment.

mgv.name: — Management Information Systems
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to computer programming and data handling skills. Use of computer in organizations, emphasis on managerial aspects of computing. Standard and nonstandard uses of data files, centralization versus decentralization of computing, office automation, computer security.

mgv.name: — Business Law
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to law and legal process in the United States. Sources of law. Structure and operation of courts, federal-state relationships, fundamentals of administrative law, fundamentals of business law.

mgv.name: — Power & Influence
mgv.description: Course Description: Investigation of the bases of power in organizations and the tactics used to translate power into influence. Topics include the control of resources (including information), social psychological processes (including commitment), the construction of meaning, and ethics.

mgv.name: — Managing People in High-Performance Organizations
mgv.description: Course Description: Explore choices firms make in managing workers–decisions as to wages, benefits, working conditions, and other management policies and practices. Analyze employment systems' fit with firms' environments and strategies, and the consequences of choices managers make regarding policies and practices.

mgv.name: — The Causes of Organizational Wrongdoing
mgv.description: Course Description: Explores the reasons why otherwise ethical, socially responsible, and law-abiding people become involved in wrongful courses of action in organizations.

mgv.name: — Pricing
mgv.description: Course Description: Combines lectures, cases and homework to teach students tools and skills necessary to analyze pricing situations, make pricing decisions, and implement them, in a systematic manner.

mgv.name: — Digital Marketing
mgv.description: Course Description: Equips students for a career in digital marketing and social media. Topics include online advertising, search engine optimization, interactive marketing, online privacy issues, e-commerce, social influence, social network theory, measurement of social influence and integrating social and traditional media.

mgv.name: — New Product Development
mgv.description: Course Description: State-of-the-art concepts and methods to enhance the effectiveness of new product development activities. Focuses on the understanding of managerial issues and acquiring the ability to solve problems.

mgv.name: — Customer Relationship Management
mgv.description: Course Description: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) is a management approach under which marketing activities are organized and measured around customers (rather than around brands.) This approach is appealing because customers, not brands, are those who make buying decisions.

mgv.name: — New & Small Business Ventures
mgv.description: Course Description: Teams develop complete business plans for their own start-up ventures. Process includes: elevator pitch, business strategy, comprehensive bottoms-up financial projections, capital requirements, product differentiation, competitive, alliance, and go-to-market strategy development, investor presentation, and comprehensive written business plan.

mgv.name: — Negotiations in Organizations
mgv.description: Course Description: Basic theory of negotiation; applies theory to process of building teams to achieve business purposes. Covers integrative and distributive strategies of claiming value, how to recognize bargaining tricks, uncovering hidden agendas, brainstorming to extend Pareto frontier.

mgv.name: — Marketing Strategy
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines process by which organizations develop strategic marketing plans. Includes definition of activities and products, marketing audits, appraising market opportunities, design of new activities and products, and organizing marketing planning function. Applications to problems in private and public sector marketing.

mgv.name: — Marketing Research
mgv.description: Course Description: Addresses the managerial issues and problems of systematically gathering and analyzing information for making private and public marketing decisions. Covers the cost and value of information, research design, information collection, measuring instruments, data analysis, and marketing research applications.

mgv.name: — Technology Competition & Strategy
mgv.description: Course Description: Covers business strategies for firms that make technology products. Looks at distinctive economic forces affecting supply, demand, and markets, asks: How do these forces impact market outcomes? And how should firms shape their competitive strategy?

mgv.name: — Management of Innovation
mgv.description: Course Description: Managing innovative enterprise in changing and uncertain environments. Covers technology forecasting and assessment, program selection and control, financial management, regulation, and ethics.

mgv.name: — Managing for Operational Excellence
mgv.description: Course Description: Explore the management of operations as applied to manufacturing, as well as services provided both inside & outside the organization. Develop an understanding of how uncertainty affects planning & delivery by looking at fundamental models of operations.

mgv.name: — Corporate Social Responsibility
mgv.description: Course Description: Develop a thought process and approach to corporate social responsibility that students will be able to build on during their post-school leadership roles, whether as corporate executives, entrepreneurs, or NGO leaders.

mgv.name: — Marketing Analytics
mgv.description: Course Description: Several econometric models commonly used in marketing practice. How data and models can be used to answer questions, generate forecasts, and make decisions.

mgv.name: — Entrepreneurship Clinic
mgv.description: Course Description: Provides the necessary analytical and design tools to create business ideas and refine business models based on emerging technologies. Students learn to work closely in small teams to synthesize technical, strategic, and marketing needs into designs for new ventures.

mgv.name: — Mergers & Acquisitions
mgv.description: Course Description: Focuses on the market for corporate acquisitions and restructuring activity. Topics include: sources of value creation; takeovers; anti-takeover provisions; bidding strategies; use of leverage in buyouts; regulatory risk and hurdles; and, valuation approaches for highly leveraged transactions.

mgv.name: — Banking & the Financial System
mgv.description: Course Description: Analyzes the role of financial markets and institutions in allocating capital. Focuses on: bank lending; debt securities; financial market innovations; regulation; functions of commercial banks and other financial intermediaries. Utilizes case studies.

mgv.name: — Corporate Finance
mgv.description: Course Description: Planning, acquiring, and managing a company's financial resources. Financial aspects of mergers and other forms of reorganization; analysis of investment, financial, and dividend policy; and theories of optimal capital structure.
mgv.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGV 200AV or MGV 202AV or MGV 205V.

mgv.name: — Investment Analysis
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines asset pricing theories and relevant evidence, including the investment performance of stocks and bonds. Topics include the efficiency of markets, domestic and international portfolio diversification, factors influencing the value of stocks and other investments, and portfolio management and performance.

mgv.name: — Derivative Securities
mgv.description: Course Description: Behavior of options, futures, and other derivative securities markets and how public agencies, business and others use those markets. Trading strategies involving options, swaps, and financial futures contracts. Pricing of derivative securities, primarily by arbitrage methods.

mgv.name: — Business Taxation
mgv.description: Course Description: Analysis of the impact of business taxation on investment, production, and finance decisions. Relationship between business organization and tax liability. Not intended for tax specialists.

mgv.name: — Technology Finance & Valuation
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines venture capital finance and the related practice of R&D finance. Goal is to apply finance tools and framework to the world of venture capital and financing of projects in high-growth industries.

mgv.name: — Teams & Technology
mgv.description: Course Description: Theory and practice of managing teams with primary goals of: providing conceptual guidelines for analyzing and diagnosing group dynamics and determining strategic options as a manager, imparting interpersonal skills for implementing effective strategies, understanding how technological change affects team processes.

mgv.name: — Articulation & Critical Thinking
mgv.description: Course Description: Public speaking, business writing, efficient and critical thinking about business challenges, and defining a personal code of ethics to shape actions and decisions.

mgv.name: — Data Mining
mgv.description: Course Description: Descriptive and Predictive Data mining methods covering association rules, clustering, classification, text mining, etc. Big data Technologies. Business applications. Hands-on data mining skills. Business intelligence for managerial decision making.

mgv.name: — Corporate Financial Reporting
mgv.description: Course Description: Analyzes and evaluates contemporary issues in financial reporting and develops implications of those issues for business decision makers, investment managers, and accounting policymakers.

mgv.name: — Evaluation of Financial Information
mgv.description: Course Description: Studies how investors, creditors, others use accounting and other information in making rational investment, lending decisions. Emphasis is placed on the analysis of financial information in a variety of contexts. Where applicable, recent research in finance and economics is discussed.

mgv.name: — Real Estate, Finance & Development
mgv.description: Course Description: Focus on single family, attached, detached, multi-family, and light commercial development. Study factors that make up successful real estate developments. Consider financial aspects involved in land acquisition, land development, construction, and project lending.

mgv.name: — Supply Chain Management
mgv.description: Course Description: Matching supply with demand is a primary challenge for a firm: excess supply is too costly, inadequate supply irritates customers. Matching supply to demand is easiest when a firm has a flexible supply process, but flexibility is generally expensive.

mgv.name: — Time Series Analysis & Forecasting
mgv.description: Course Description: Consider application of time series methods to evaluation & forecasting problems. Covers univariate & multivariate ARIMA models and transfer function models. Applications in such areas as economics, finance, budgeting, program evaluation, and industrial process control.

mgv.name: — Business Database & Database Marketing
mgv.description: Course Description: Practical introduction to fundamental principles of database management systems and database marketing. Database design. SQL queries. Concepts of database marketing, data warehouse, data visualization and big data analytics.
mgv.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in the Graduate School of Management or consent of instructor required.

mgv.name: — Topics in General Management
mgv.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in MGV 201AV and MGV 201BV, or current business interest topics in fields of business writing, business communications, development, or workplace processes.

mgv.name: — Topics in International Management
mgv.description: Course Description: International environment in which U.S. firms and their foreign competitors operate. May integrate topics in marketing, strategy, finance, accounting, information technology, or technology management in an international context.
mgv.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in the Graduate School of Management or consent of instructor required.

mgv.name: — Financial Accounting
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to the concepts and objectives underlying the preparation of financial statements. Topics include understanding the accounting cycle, measurement and valuation problems associated with financial statement components, consideration of the usefulness of financial statements in the analysis of a corporation’s operations.

mgv.name: — Quantitative Tools for Business
mgv.description: Course Description: Quantitative analysis and business storytelling through practical quantitative frameworks, descriptive procedures and real life case studies.

mgv.name: — Integrated Management Project
mgv.description: Course Description: Examines the scope of missions, objectives strategies, policies, structures, measurements and incentives which bear on the management of an organization. Simulated organizations in the private and public sectors, are assigned to student teams as the subjects of study.
mgv.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year core courses of online MBA program.

mgv.name: — Product Management
mgv.description: Course Description: Overview of the requirements, issues, and tools involved in marketing of products and services via lectures, case studies, and a hands-on, quarter-long competitive simulation.

mgv.name: — Managing for Operational Excellence
mgv.description: Course Description: Explore the management of operations as applied to manufacturing, as well as services provided both inside & outside the organization. Develop an understanding of how uncertainty affects planning & delivery by looking at fundamental models of operations.

mgv.name: — Articulation & Critical Thinking
mgv.description: Course Description: Public speaking, business writing, efficient and critical thinking about business challenges, and defining a personal code of ethics to shape actions and decisions.

mgv.name: — Machine Learning with Python
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduction to Machine Learning methods covering association rules, clustering, classification, and numeric prediction. Hands-on Machine Learning skills with Python. Big data technologies. Business applications.

mgv.name: — R & SQL for Business Analytics
mgv.description: Course Description: Introduces programming concepts and how they can be applied to derive insights from data and make management decisions.

mgv.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, and workplace processes.

mgv.name: — Topics in Management–Extended
mgv.description: Course Description: Extended topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively; management, organizational behavior, finance, marketing, accounting and business analytics.

Application of these methods to marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.

mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate student or consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Business Law
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to law and legal process in the United States. Sources of law. Structure and operation of courts, federal-state relationships, fundamentals of administrative law, fundamentals of business law.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of administration core requirements or petition with consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Managing Professionals, Budgets, Controls & Ethics
mgp.description: Course Description: Performance measures, budgetary controls and ethical pressures which occur at middle management levels in service-type operations. Addresses such organizations as engineering, medical groups, law offices, management consultants.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.

mgp.name: — Management of Social Networks
mgp.description: Course Description: Principles and applications of social network theory: coordinating divergent interests to create value for individuals and organizations. Emphasis on conceptual models, web-based diagnostic tools, and practical applications.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 201A.

mgp.name: — Power & Influence in Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Investigation of the bases of power in organizations and the tactics used to translate power into influence. Topics include the control of resources (including information), social psychological processes (including commitment), the construction of meaning, and ethics.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 201A or MGB 201A or MGP 201A; consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Managing People in High-Performance Organizations
mgp.description: Course Description: Strategic approach to the management of people within organization. Analyze employment systems' fit with firms' environments and strategies. Explore consequences of choices firms make in managing people; decisions as to selection, performance evaluation, compensation, and other management policies and practices.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 201A or MGB 201A or MGP 201A.

mgp.name: — Pricing
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Combines lectures, cases and homework to teach students tools and skills necessary to analyze pricing situations, make pricing decisions, and implement them, in a systematic manner.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 202A or MGV 202AV or MGP 202A); (MGP 203B or MGB 203B or MGT 203B); (MGT 204 or MGB 204 or MGP 204).

mgp.name: — Digital Marketing
mgp.description: Course Description: Equips students for a career in digital marketing and social media. Topics include online advertising, search engine optimization, interactive mktg, online privacy issues, e-commerce, social influence, social network theory, measurement of social influence, integrating social and traditional media.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 204 or MGT 204 or MGB 204.

mgp.name: — Management Policy & Strategy
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines the scope of missions, objectives strategies, policies, structures, measurements and incentives which bear on the management of an organization. Real client organizations, in the private and public sectors, are assigned to student teams as the subjects of study.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year core courses of M.B.A. program.

mgp.name: — New Product Development
mgp.description: Course Description: State-of-the-art concepts and methods to enhance the effectiveness of new product development activities. Focuses on the understanding of managerial issues and acquiring the ability to solve problems.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 204 or MGB 204 or MGP 204.

mgp.name: — Marketing Communications
mgp.description: Course Description: Issues in designing a marketing communications strategy. Topics include mass and direct communications, institutional aspects of advertising, consumer behavior, evaluating ad effectiveness, determining ad budget, creative strategy, and use and abuse of promotions.

mgp.name: — Customer Relationship Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) is a management approach under which marketing activities are organized and measured around customers (rather than around brands.) This approach is appealing because customers, not brands, are those who make buying decisions.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 204 or MGP 204 or MGB 204.

mgp.name: — New & Small Business Ventures
mgp.description: Course Description: Student teams develop complete business plans for their own start-up ventures. Process includes: elevator pitch, business strategy, comprehensive bottoms-up financial projections, capital requirements, product differentiation, competitive, alliance, and go-to-market strategy development, investor presentation, and comprehensive written business plan.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 204 or MGB 204 or MGP 204.

mgp.name: — Business Writing
mgp.description: Course Description: Techniques for sharpening writing skills are introduced, along with grammatical structure, word choice, and punctuation. Learn to develop styles that are pitch-perfect for given situations and to think strategically about each communication challenge in a management setting.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of first-year core courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Negotiation & Team Building
mgp.description: Course Description: Basic theory of negotiation; applies theory to process of building teams to achieve business purposes. Covers integrative and distributive strategies of claiming value, how to recognize bargaining tricks, uncovering hidden agendas, brainstorming to extend Pareto frontier.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 205; MGP 202.

mgp.name: — Customer Service as a Marketing Tool
mgp.description: Course Description: Understanding the distinct features of services, how to create value through service, methods of building strong relationships with customers, methods of measuring and building customer satisfaction, and measuring the financial impact of service improvement.

mgp.name: — Marketing Strategies
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines process by which organizations develop strategic marketing plans. Includes definition of activities and products, marketing audits, appraising market opportunities, design of new activities and products, and organizing marketing planning function. Applications to problems in private and public sector marketing.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 202A or MGV 202AV or MGP 202A); (MGP 204 or MGB 204 or MGT 204).

mgp.name: — Marketing Research
mgp.description: Course Description: Addresses the managerial issues and problems of systematically gathering and analyzing information for making private and public marketing decisions. Covers the cost and value of information, research design, information collection, measuring instruments, data analysis, and marketing research applications.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 202A or MGV 202AV or MGP 202A); (MGP 203A or MGB 203A or MGT 203A); (MGT 204 or MGB 204 or MGP 204).

mgp.name: — Technology, Competition & Strategy
mgp.description: Course Description: Why is software typically so defective? Why do many firms in the IT industry give away their best products free? Helps analyze questions like these by modeling competition and strategy in the network, technology and information industries.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 202A or MGV 202AV or MGP 202A); (MGP 203A or MGB 203A or MGT 203A).

mgp.name: — Management of Innovation
mgp.description: Course Description: Managing innovative enterprise in changing and uncertain environments. Covers technology forecasting and assessment, program selection and control, financial management, regulation, and ethics.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 201A or MGB 201A or MGP 201A.

mgp.name: — Managing for Operational Excellence
mgp.description: Course Description: Explores the management of operations as applied to manufacturing as well as services provided both inside and outside the organization. Develop an understanding of how uncertainty affects planning and delivery by looking at fundamental models of operations.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 203A or MGB 203A or MGT 203A.

mgp.name: — Corporate Social Responsibility
mgp.description: Course Description: Develop a thought process and approach to corporate social responsibility that students will be able to build on during their post-school leadership roles, whether as corporate executives, entrepreneurs, or NGO leaders.

mgp.name: — Entrepreneurship & Venture Investment Clinic
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides the necessary analytical and design tools to create business ideas and refine business models based on emerging technologies. Students learn to work closely in small teams to synthesize technical, strategic, and marketing needs into designs for new ventures.

mgp.name: — Mergers & Acquisitions
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the market for corporate acquisitions and restructuring activity. Topics include: sources of value creation; takeovers; anti-takeover provisions; bidding strategies; use of leverage in buyouts; regulatory risk and hurdles; and, valuation approaches for highly leveraged transactions.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 205 or MGT 205 or MGB 205.

mgp.name: — Banking & the Financial System
mgp.description: Course Description: Analyzes the role of financial markets and institutions in allocating capital. Focuses on: bank lending; debt securities; financial market innovations; regulation; functions of commercial banks and other financial intermediaries. Utilizes case studies.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGB 205 or MGT 205; consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Corporate Finance
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on planning, acquiring, and managing a company's financial resources. Includes discussion of financial aspects of mergers and other forms of reorganization; analysis of investment, financial, and dividend policy; and theories of optimal capital structure.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 200A or MGB 200A or MGP 200A); (MGP 202A or MGV 202AV or MGT 202A); (MGT 205 or MGB 205 or MGP 205).

mgp.name: — Investment Analysis
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines asset pricing theories and relevant evidence, including the investment performance of stocks and bonds. Topics include the efficiency of markets, domestic and international portfolio diversification, factors influencing the value of stocks and other investments, and portfolio management and performance.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 203A or MGP 203A or MGB 203A); (MGB 205 or MGT 205 or MGP 205).

mgp.name: — Money & Security Markets
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines how money and securities markets are organized; how public agencies, businesses, others obtain and invest funds in those markets. Relationship between interest rates, monetary policy, government's role in improving capital markets, approaches to assessing changes in regulation of specific markets.

mgp.name: — Derivative Securities
mgp.description: Course Description: Behavior of options, futures, and other derivative securities markets and how public agencies, business and others use those markets. Trading strategies involving options, swaps, and financial futures contracts. Pricing of derivative securities, primarily by arbitrage methods.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 205 or MGP 205 or MGB 205); (MGT 203A or MGP 203A or MGB 203A).

mgp.name: — Business Taxation
mgp.description: Course Description: Analysis of the impact of business taxation on investment, production, and finance decisions. Discussion of the relationship between business organization and tax liability. Not intended for tax specialists.

mgp.name: — Technology Finance & Valuation
mgp.description: Course Description: Venture capital finance and the related practice of research and development finance. Application of finance tools and framework to the world of venture capital and financing of projects in high-growth industries.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGB 205 or MGP 205 or MGT 205.

mgp.name: — International Finance
mgp.description: Course Description: Studies fixed and floating exchange-rate systems. Topics include determinants of a nation's balance of international payments; macroeconomic interdependence of nations under various exchange-rate regimes and its implications for domestic stabilization policies; and the international coordination of monetary and stabilization policies.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 205 or MGB 205 or MGP 205; or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Teams & Technology
mgp.description: Course Description: Theory and practice of managing teams with primary goals of: providing conceptual guidelines for analyzing and diagnosing group dynamics and determining strategic options as a manager; imparting interpersonal skills for implementing effective strategies; understanding how technological change affects team processes.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Articulation & Critical Thinking
mgp.description: Course Description: With commitment to this course, students will become competent public speakers, write well at a level expected in business, think efficiently and critically about business challenges and have a useful personal code of ethics to shape their actions and decisions. No student may repeat course for credit.

mgp.name: — Machine Learning with Python
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to machine learning methods covering association rules, clustering, classification, and numeric prediction. Hands-on machine learning skills with Python. Big data technologies. Business applications.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Corporate Financial Reporting
mgp.description: Course Description: Analyzes and evaluates contemporary issues in financial reporting and develops implications of those issues for business decision makers, investment managers, and accounting policymakers.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 200A or MGP 200A or MGB 200A.

mgp.name: — Strategic Cost Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Theoretical frameworks and associated techniques for using organizational design and cost management to achieve a sustainable, profitable cost structure. Topics include: target costing, process design for low cost, total cost of ownership, cost of customers, implementing structural change, and incentives.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 202A or MGP 202A or MGV 202AV.

mgp.name: — Evaluation of Financial Information
mgp.description: Course Description: Studies how investors, creditors, others use accounting and other information in making rational investment, lending decisions. Emphasis is placed on the analysis of financial information in a variety of contexts. Where applicable, recent research in finance and economics is discussed.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 200A or MGB 200A or MGP 200A.

mgp.name: — Accounting & Reporting for Government Nonprofit Entities
mgp.description: Course Description: Concepts, methods, and uses of accounting and financial reporting by governmental and nonprofit entities. Introduction to budgeting and performance evaluation, and accounting for entities such as hospitals, universities, and welfare agencies.

mgp.name: — Corporate Governance
mgp.description: Course Description: Discusses how corporations can better operate in the interests of shareholders and public. Directly relevant to managers, consultants in compensation and incentives, staff working on mergers and acquisitions, corporate regulators, shareholders rights activists, and board members.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Full-time MBA students or consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Real Estate, Finance & Development
mgp.description: Course Description: Focus on single family, attached, detached, multi-family, and light commercial development. Study factors that make up successful real estate developments. Consider financial aspects involved in land acquisition, land development, construction, and project lending.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 205 or MGB 205 or MGP 205); (MGP 201A or MGB 201A or MGT 201A).

mgp.name: — Systems Analysis & Design
mgp.description: Course Description: Design and specification of computer-based information systems. Applications systems development life cycle, use requirements and feasibility assessment, logical and physical design, program development and testing, conversion and implementation.

mgp.name: — Supply Chain Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Matching supply with demand is a primary challenge for a firm: excess supply is too costly, inadequate supply irritates customers. Matching supply to demand is easiest when a firm has a flexible supply process, but flexibility is generally expensive.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 203A or MGB 203A or MGP 203A.

mgp.name: — Applied Linear Models for Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Covers regression, analysis of variance, and multivariate analysis. Topics will focus on applications to management and policy problems.

mgp.name: — Time Series Analysis & Forecasting
mgp.description: Course Description: Considers application of time series methods to evaluation and forecasting problems. Covers univariate and multivariate ARIMA models and transfer function models. Applications will be in such areas as economics, finance, budgeting, program evaluation, and industrial process control.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 203B or MGT 203B or MGB 203B.

mgp.name: — Telecommunications & Computer Networks
mgp.description: Course Description: Communication system components; common carrier services; design and control of communications networks; network management and distributed environment; local area networks; data security in computer networks.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 280.

mgp.name: — Business Database & Database Marketing
mgp.description: Course Description: Practical introduction to fundamental principles of database management systems and database marketing. Database design. SQL queries. Concepts of database marketing, data warehouse, data visualization and big data analytics.

mgp.name: — Topics in General Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in MGT 201A and MGT 201B, or current business interest topics in fields of business writing, business communications, development, or workplace processes.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Organizational Behavior
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in social psychology and sociology of organizations. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in MGP 201A and MGP 201B, or current business interest topics in fields of organization design, strategy, development, or workplace processes.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Finance
mgp.description: Course Description: Contemporary and emerging issues in finance. Application of modern techniques of finance to business problems. Use of appropriate electronic database and research techniques.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Marketing
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in marketing, which may include marketing research, new product development, brand management, pricing, distribution management, service marketing, hitech marketing, advertising, sales promotions, marketing through the Web.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Accounting
mgp.description: Course Description: Contemporary and emerging issues in financial management accounting. Application of modern techniques of evaluation and analysis of financial information. Use of appropriate electronic database and research techniques.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Information Technology
mgp.description: Course Description: Applications of information technology to management and management of information technology. Adaptation to the dynamic nature of the field.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in Technology Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Cyclical nature of innovation and technological change, features of innovative firms and industries, national innovation systems, and impact of information technologies on innovation processes.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Topics in International Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Broader environment in which U.S. firms and their foreign competitors operate. Integration of material from other topics courses (marketing, strategy, finance, accounting, information technology, technology management) into the international setting.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of all first-year graduate courses at the Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgp.name: — Directed Group Study
mgp.description: Course Description: Directed group study.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Individual Study
mgp.description: Course Description: Individual study.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mgp.name: — Financial Accounting
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to the concepts and objectives underlying the preparation of financial statements. Topics include understanding the accounting cycle, measurement and valuation problems associated with financial statement components, consideration of the usefulness of financial statements in the analysis of a corporation’s operations.

mgp.name: — Financial Accounting
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to the concepts and objectives underlying the preparation of financial statements. Topics include understanding the accounting cycle, measurement and valuation problems associated with financial statement components, consideration of the usefulness of financial statements in the analysis of a corporation’s operations.

mgp.name: — Crisis Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Establishes and explores the defining characteristics of crises. Will learn to anchor crisis management firmly within overall strategic management and also acquire a set of useful tools and techniques for planning for and handling actual crises.

mgp.name: — The Individual & Group Dynamics
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines basic psychological and social psychological processes shaping human behavior and applies knowledge of these processes to the following organizational problems: motivation, job design, commitment, socialization, culture, individual and group decision making, and team building.

mgp.name: — Individual & Group Dynamics
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines basic psychological and social psychological processes shaping human behavior and applies knowledge of these processes to the following organizational problems: motivation, job design, commitment, socialization, culture, individual and group decision making, and team building.

mgp.name: — Organizational Strategy & Structure
mgp.description: Course Description: Strategic management of organizations, including analysis of industries, firm resources and capabilities and corporate strategy. Strategy formulation, implementation and strategic decision-making. Firm and industry life cycles and change. Analysis of organizational design and structure including differentiation and integration.

mgp.name: — Organizational Strategy & Structure
mgp.description: Course Description: Strategic management of organizations, including analysis of industries, firm resources and capabilities and corporate strategy. Strategy formulation, implementation and strategic decision-making. Firm and industry life cycles and change. Analysis of organizational design and structure including differentiation and integration.

mgp.name: — Crisis Communications & Reputation Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Intended to provide you with an understanding of the framework and tools necessary to successfully address communications and reputation management tasks in a variety of crisis situations.

mgp.name: — Markets & the Firm
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines the interaction of consumers, firms and government, and the effect this interaction has on the use of resources and firm profitability. Fundamental economic concepts such as marginal analysis, opportunity cost, pricing, and externalities are introduced and applied.

mgp.name: — Markets & the Firm
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines the interaction of consumers, firms and government, and the effect this interaction has on the use of resources and firm profitability. Fundamental economic concepts such as marginal analysis, opportunity cost, pricing, and externalities are introduced and applied.

mgp.name: — Business Statistics Practicum
mgp.description: Course Description: Applies techniques and concepts in business statistics to real case studies.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 203A or MGP 203A or MGB 203A); (MGT 203B (can be concurrent) or MGP 203B (can be concurrent) or MGB 203B (can be concurrent)); MGT 203B, MGP 203B, or MGB 203B completed or required concurrently.

mgp.name: — Data Analysis for Managers
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to statistics and data analysis for managerial decision making. Descriptive statistics, principles of data collection, sampling, quality control, statistical inference. Application of data analytic methods to problems in marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.

mgp.name: — Data Analysis for Managers
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to statistics and data analysis for managerial decision making. Descriptive statistics, principles of data collection, sampling, quality control, statistical inference. Application of data analytic methods to problems in marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.

mgp.name: — Marketing Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Analysis of market opportunities, elements of market research, development of marketing strategies, market planning and implementations, and control systems. Consumer and industrial markets, market segmentation, pricing strategies, distribution channels, promotion, and sales.

mgp.name: — Marketing Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Analysis of market opportunities, elements of market research, development of marketing strategies, market planning and implementations, and control systems. Consumer and industrial markets, market segmentation, pricing strategies, distribution channels, promotion, and sales.

mgp.name: — Financial Theory & Policy
mgp.description: Course Description: Corporate financial policy and investment management. Covers capital budgeting, optimal financial structure, cost-of-capital determination, risk measurement. Develops basic valuation principles for investments with long-lived and risky cash-flows, and extends these to derivative securities, asset portfolios, investment management and hedging.

mgp.name: — Financial Theory & Policy
mgp.description: Course Description: Corporate financial policy and investment management. Covers capital budgeting, optimal financial structure, cost-of-capital determination, risk measurement. Develops basic valuation principles for investments with long-lived and risky cash-flows, and extends these to derivative securities, asset portfolios, investment management and hedging.

mgp.name: — Ethical Issues in Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Explores the philosophical foundation of ethical theory and its recent applications to business situations. Professional codes of ethics, such as those promulgated by educational, managerial, engineering, scientific, medical and legal professional societies, are presented.

mgp.name: — Decision Analytics: Spreadsheet Based
mgp.description: Course Description: Develops decision-making and problem-solving skills in conjunction with a quantitative model-building approach.

mgp.name: — Decision Analytics: Scalable
mgp.description: Course Description: Builds on concepts learned in 406A to develop techniques for describing and implementing models that can scale in all dimensions.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 406A or MGP 406A or MGB 406A.

mgp.name: — Storytelling for Leadership
mgp.description: Course Description: Internalize the fundamental principles behind stories that educate, influence, motivate, inspire, persuade and connect.

mgp.name: — The Business of the Media
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the media industries and how emerging digital technologies are disrupting the way media consumption, distribution and business models work. Will highlight the economics of several media, both news and entertainment.

mgp.name: — The Business of the Media
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the media industries and how emerging digital technologies are disrupting the way media consumption, distribution and business models work. Will highlight the economics of several media, both news and entertainment.

mgp.name: — Managing Multi-Asset Class Investment Portfolios
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines top down management of multi-asset class portfolios. Topics include bonds, hedge funds, private equity, real estate, commodities, endowments, return generation, performance analysis, credit cycles, financial crises, manager selection, investment policy, and investment careers. Student teams present endowment portfolio recommendations.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 202A; MGP 203A; MGP 205.

mgp.name: — Corporate Governance
mgp.description: Course Description: Covers recent and not-so-recent business and accounting scandals, discuss how corporations can better operate in the interests of shareholders, and the public and learn from people who rely on corporate governance in making investment decisions.

mgp.name: — Turnaround Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Evaluate the financial performance of a company, identify opportunities for improvement, propose real solutions to enhance performance, and most important inspire action in staff.

mgp.name: — International Marketing
mgp.description: Course Description: Basic concepts of international marketing. Understanding and managing heterogeneous, dynamic, and interdependent environments across countries. How to develop and implement an international marketing strategy: where and how to compete, how to adapt to your marketing mix.

mgp.name: — Sustainable Business Ventures: Business & Energy
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to sustainability goals, indicators, values, measurement techniques, and practice how it applies to large and small enterprise.

mgp.name: — Multi-Channel Marketing
mgp.description: Course Description: Multi-channel marketing strategies empower managers to create value for different customer segments. Covers the necessary concepts to evaluate and select go-to market strategies in order to capitalize on the ubiquity of modern customers.

mgp.name: — Climate Risks & Opportunities
mgp.description: Course Description: Provide a working knowledge of the risks and opportunities arising from climate change and climate policy for businesses.

mgp.name: — Business Law
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to law and legal process in the United States. Sources of law. Structure and operation of courts, federal-state relationships, fundamentals of administrative law, fundamentals of business law.

mgp.name: — Topics in Private Equity
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the finance principles related to the risk and return of the private equity (PE) industry, valuation of PE target companies, the structuring of leveraged buyouts (LBOs), and the management of portfolio companies.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 205 or MGT 205 or MGB 205.

mgp.name: — Incentives & Controls
mgp.description: Course Description: Understand how organizations use financial and nonfinancial performance management and incentive systems to motivate people and manage resources.

mgp.name: — Scientific Discovery & Business Innovation at Scale in the Food & Agriculture Sector
mgp.description: Course Description: Scientific discovery and business innovation within the food and agriculture sector profoundly influences the sustainability of society and enterprise competitiveness. Students will learn how business innovation models co-exist antagonistically or synergistically with scientific discovery and its influence on enterprise competitiveness.

mgp.name: — Business Strategy Consulting Skills
mgp.description: Course Description: Students will learn practical business consulting skills which will help apply strategy theories in the workplace. Students will learn and practice tools to frame and analyze problems, conduct research, communicate findings and navigate client relationships.

mgp.name: — Business Strategy Consulting Skills
mgp.description: Course Description: Students will learn practical business consulting skills which will help apply strategy theories in the workplace. Students will learn and practice tools to frame and analyze problems, conduct research, communicate findings and navigate client relationships.

mgp.name: — Advanced Optimization in a Python-based Modeling Language
mgp.description: Course Description: Covers advanced optimization modeling techniques and practical application of modern, scalable modeling language. Techniques will be developed using examples from production planning in a supply chain, but students may explore other areas of application of optimization for their final project.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGP 252 or MGB 252 or MGT 252); (MGP 206 or MGB 206 or MGT 206).

mgp.name: — Monte Carlo Simulation for Managerial Analysis
mgp.description: Course Description: Create Excel-based simulation models across business domains, from finance to hypothesis testing and inventory management. By course-end, students are experts at recognizing this decision-making fallacy and fixing it.

mgp.name: — Behavioral Finance & Valuation
mgp.description: Course Description: Investor psychology and market frictions can cause asset prices to deviate from fundamental values, creating profit opportunities for sophisticated investors. Covers techniques of financial analysis with the goal of learning how to value assets and identify mispricing.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 260 or MGP 260 or MGB 260); (MGT 261 or MGP 261 or MGB 261)

mgp.name: — Leader as Coach: An Introduction to Coaching Skills for Leaders
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduces the fundamental coaching skills and coaching models that leaders can apply in everyday interactions with their team and colleagues in order to build trust, overcome challenges and help others discover their own full potential.

mgp.name: — Power & Influence in Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Investigation of the bases of power in organizations and the tactics used to translate power into influence. Topics include the control of resources (including information), social psychological processes (including commitment), the construction of meaning, and ethics.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 201A or MGP 201A or MGB 201A.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Managing People in Modern Organizations
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides solid grounding in the management of work and the employment relationship. Examines firms’ interrelated policies and practices for managing people.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 224.

mgp.name: — Digital Marketing Techniques
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides students with an introduction to digital marketing. Introduces MBA students to the fundamental aspects and tools of online marketing communication, i.e., how organizations use digital channels to effectively communicate their value propositions to the target customers.

mgp.name: — The Business of Healthcare
mgp.description: Course Description: Intended to provide an overall understanding of the unique business aspects of the healthcare industry.

mgp.name: — Implementing International Strategy
mgp.description: Course Description: Looks at the pitfalls of implementing international strategies, and suggest several accessible, yet powerful frameworks to help international managers implement strategies successfully and completely.

mgp.name: — Renewable Energy Ventures
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced innovation lab will introduce students to issues addressed by entrepreneurs and investors in renewable ventures. Lectures, simulations, case studies and practical experience of the presenters will be delivered.

mgp.name: — Detection & Prevention of Asset Misappropriation Fraud in the Workplace
mgp.description: Course Description: Discusses the fundamentals of fraud detection and prevention in the workplace. Learn the major schemes involving workplace fraud, how management can detect fraud and what policies and procedures can be implemented to prevent fraud.

mgp.name: — Learning From Catastrophes: Lessons for Managers
mgp.description: Course Description: Catastrophes unfold in surprisingly similar ways. Analyze catastrophes to understand these common patterns and investigate how they can be prevented and mitigated. Apply these lessons to management to gain unconventional insights.

mgp.name: — Project Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Students learn project management; including project scope, project planning, milestones and project closing. Important themes include leadership, team dynamics, storytelling/creating a narrative, communication, and conflict management.

mgp.name: — Project Management with Applications in Healthcare
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the heart of healthcare administration and how project management can be applied as a key lever to increase efficiency, decrease costs and improve the patient experience.

mgp.name: — Project Management with Applications in Healthcare
mgp.description: Course Description: Focuses on the heart of healthcare administration and how project management can be applied as a key lever to increase efficiency, decrease costs and improve the patient experience.

mgp.name: — Corporate Social Responsibility
mgp.description: Course Description: Learn practical information that will help students understand the basics of designing, managing and evaluating an effective CSR program. Expose students to a basic set of CSR issues in the context of cross-purpose business challenges and then focus on the analysis and critical decisions that managers must make to move their business and their social agenda forward.

mgp.name: — Data Wrangling
mgp.description: Course Description: Develop practical skills to pre-process data. Tidied raw data can then be used for downstream data analysis, modeling, and visualization.

mgp.name: — Introduction to Derivative Securities
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to derivative securities and other forms of financial innovations.

mgp.name: — Healthcare Analytics
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to advanced analytics framework, key Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning concepts, and modeling techniques towards solving high-value and high-impact healthcare business problems.

mgp.name: — Healthcare Analytics
mgp.description: Course Description: Introduction to advanced analytics framework, key Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning concepts, and modeling techniques towards solving high-value and high-impact healthcare business problems.

mgp.name: — Integrated Management Project
mgp.description: Course Description: Applies classroom learning to solve complex business challenges for real-world clients. Students learn practical consulting skills while their clients benefit from the student’s experience, insights, and work product.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year core courses of MBA program.

mgp.name: — Integrated Management Project
mgp.description: Course Description: Applies classroom learning to solve complex business challenges for real world clients. Student teams learn practical consulting skills while their clients benefit from the student’s experience, insights, and work product.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year core courses of MBA program.

mgp.name: — Integrated Management Project
mgp.description: Course Description: Applies classroom learning to solve complex business challenges for real world clients. Student teams learn practical consulting skills while their clients benefit from the student’s experience, insights, and work product.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): First-year core courses of MBA program.

mgp.name: — Integrated Management Project Lead
mgp.description: Course Description: Integrated Management Project Team leader.

mgp.name: — Integrated Management Simulation
mgp.description: Course Description: Apply theory and concepts from marketing, finance, organizational behavior, accounting, and strategy in order to manage a simulated corporation.

mgp.name: — New Product Development
mgp.description: Course Description: State-of-the-art concepts and methods to enhance the effectiveness of new product development activities. Focuses on the understanding of managerial issues and acquiring the ability to solve problems.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 204 or MGP 204 or MGB 204.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Marketing Communication
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides experience applying concepts learned in Marketing Communications to a realistic advertising or communication problem faced by firms.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 242.

mgp.name: — Customer Analytics
mgp.description: Course Description: Teaches how to use customer analytics to learn about and market to individual customers. Examines the different types of data analytics and how they fit into the customer relationship management world.

mgp.name: — Customer Analytics
mgp.description: Course Description: Teaches students how to use customer analytics to learn about and market to individual customers. Examines the different types of data analytics and how they fit into the customer relationship management world.

mgp.name: — Product Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Overview of the requirements, issues, and tools involved in marketing of products and services via lectures, case studies, and a hands-on, quarter-long competitive simulation.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 404 or MGP 404 or MGB 404.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Marketing Strategies
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides opportunities to apply the concepts covered in the Marketing Strategies class through a group project involving the analysis of strategic marketing decisions based on business-related issues, simulation and modeling.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 248.

mgp.name: — Marketing Strategies
mgp.description: Course Description: Examines process by which organizations develop strategic marketing plans. Includes definition of activities and products, marketing audits, appraising market opportunities, design of new activities and products, and organizing marketing planning function. Applications to problems in private and public sector marketing.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 202A or MGP 202A or MGB 202A); (MGT 204 or MGP 204 or MGB 204).

mgp.name: — Marketing Research Practicum
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides opportunities to apply the concepts and methods covered in the Marketing Research class. Hands-on and project-based, work could be either individual or in groups depending on enrollments and/or interests of students.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 249.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Technology Strategy & Competition
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: In-depth practicum project course. Apply theories, concepts, and models, learned in MGP 250 to a real-world business problem, through data collection, data analysis, simulation, modeling and post-model interpretation.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 250.

mgp.name: — Managing for Operational Excellence
mgp.description: Course Description: Explore the management of operations as applied to manufacturing, as well as services provided both inside & outside the organization. Develop an understanding of how uncertainty affects planning & delivery by looking at fundamental models of operations.

mgp.name: — Managing for Operational Excellence
mgp.description: Course Description: Explore the management of operations as applied to manufacturing, as well as services provided both inside & outside the organization. Develop an understanding of how uncertainty affects planning & delivery by looking at fundamental models of operations.

mgp.name: — Causal Inference and Statistical Experiments
mgp.description: Course Description: Surveys causal inference methods with applications in business settings, especially marketing. Covers both primary data approaches such as A/B testing and secondary data approaches such as difference-in-differences.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 403A or MGP 403A or MGB 403A.

mgp.name: — Marketing Analytics
mgp.description: Course Description: Surveys a variety of marketing analytics applications, training students to identify (i) what questions data can answer, and, conversely, (ii) what data is needed to answer a question.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 454A or MGP 454A or MGB 454A.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Corporate Finance & Real Estate
mgp.description: Course Description: Work in groups to select and value a financial entity. It could be a firm, a sports player, a building, a project, or a patent. Grade based on an in-class presentation and a write-up.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 260.

mgp.name: — Corporate Finance: Fundamentals
mgp.description: Course Description: Study valuation techniques in applied settings, study a variety of investment decisions, and analyze how capital structure considerations play a role in firm’s investment policies.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 205 or MGP 205 or MGB 205.

mgp.name: — Corporate Finance: Advanced Topics
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced course in corporate finance that builds on 460A, with an aim to extend knowledge of the theory and practice of corporate finance.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 460A or MGP 460A or MGB 460A.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Investment Analysis
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides practical experience applying concepts learned in Investment Analysis to a realistic portfolio management setting via a hypothetical exercise. Produce a realistic executive summary and presentation of an investment proposal for a hypothetical client.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 261.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Taxes & Business Strategy
mgp.description: Course Description: Practical application project drawing from the tax planning theory contained in MGP 264. Project consists of a business formation and operation, change in organization (incorporation), and movement into multi-national and multi-jurisdictional tax.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 264.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Venture Capital
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides an opportunity to apply concepts learned in Venture Capital in a realistic setting. Complete project analyzing a potential investment in a hypothetical venture and prepare an deal term sheet/investment agreement.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 265.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Teams & Technology
mgp.description: Course Description: Groups investigate the performance, creativity, conflict, information sharing, and leadership behaviors of a real world team. Provide consulting advice to the team, which not only gives analytic skills, but also builds presentation skills.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 267.

mgp.name: — Teams & Technology
mgp.description: Course Description: Theory and practice of managing teams with primary goals of: providing conceptual guidelines for analyzing and diagnosing group dynamics and determining strategic options as a manager; imparting interpersonal skills for implementing effective strategies; understanding how technological change affects team processes.

mgp.name: — Articulation & Critical Thinking
mgp.description: Course Description: Public speaking, business writing, efficient and critical thinking about business challenges, and defining a personal code of ethics to shape actions and decisions.

mgp.name: — Articulation & Critical Thinking
mgp.description: Course Description: Public speaking, business writing, efficient and critical thinking about business challenges, and defining a personal code of ethics to shape actions and decisions.

mgp.name: — Practicum for Business Intelligence Technologies
mgp.description: Course Description: Projects applying concepts learned in Business Intelligence Technologies to real business problems.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGP 269.

mgp.name: — Real Estate, Finance & Development
mgp.description: Course Description: Focus on single family, attached, detached, multi-family, and light commercial development. Study factors which make up successful real estate developments. Consider financial aspects involved in land acquisition, land development, construction, and project lending.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MGT 401A or MGP 401A or MGB 401A); (MGT 405 or MGP 405 or MGB 405).

mgp.name: — Practicum for Supply Chain Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides experience applying concepts learned in Supply Chain Management to a realistic management setting via a project.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 282 (can be concurrent) or MGP 282 (can be concurrent) or MGB 282 (can be concurrent); course is a pre-requisite or co-requisite.

mgp.name: — Topics in Business
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides opportunity for students to gain experience in applying business methodologies previously acquired in other GSM courses.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Sponsorship of a GSM Academic Senate faculty member; approval of graduate advisor.

mgp.name: — Topics in Management
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such as business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, and workplace processes.

mgp.name: — Topics in General Management-Extended
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, finance and workplace processes.

mgp.name: — Topics in Management
mgp.description: Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in the MBA core such business writing, management, organizational behavior, business communications, development, and workplace processes.

mgp.name: — Topics in General Management
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in general management. Varied topics to cover more extensively issues discussed in MGT 201A and MGT 201B, or current business interest topics in fields of business writing, business communications, development, or workplace processes.

mgp.name: — Topics in Finance
mgp.description: Course Description: Contemporary and emerging issues in finance. Application of modern techniques of finance to business problems. Use of appropriate electronic database and research techniques.

mgp.name: — Topics in Marketing
mgp.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Advanced topics in marketing, which may include marketing research, new product development, brand management, pricing, distribution management, service marketing, hi-tech marketing, advertising, sales promotions, marketing through the Web.

mgp.name: — Directed Group Study Management Practicum
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides the opportunity for students to gain experience in applying business methodologies previously acquired in other GSM courses.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Sponsorship of a GSM Academic Senate faculty member; approval of graduate advisor.

mgp.name: — Directed Individual Study Management Practicum
mgp.description: Course Description: Provides the opportunity for students to gain experience in applying business methodologies previously acquired in other Graduate School of Management courses.
mgp.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Sponsorship of a Graduate School of Management Academic Senate faculty member; approval of graduate advisor.

mgb.name: — Financial Accounting
mgb.description: Course Description: Introduction to the concepts and objectives underlying the preparation of financial statements. Topics include understanding the accounting cycle, measurement and valuation problems associated with financial statement components, consideration of the usefulness of financial statements in the analysis of a corporation's operations.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate student in the Graduate School of Management.

mgb.name: — Managerial Accounting
mgb.description: Course Description: Information managers should know to be effective, including: product costing, motivating people, and differential analysis for decision making. Includes team projects and written and oral presentations.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 200A or MGB 200A or MGP 200A.

mgb.name: — The Individual & Group Dynamics
mgb.description: Course Description: Examines basic psychological and social psychological processes shaping human behavior and applies knowledge of these processes to the following organizational problems: motivation, job design, commitment, socialization, culture, individual and group decision making, and team building.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate student in the Graduate School of Management.

mgb.name: — Organizational Strategy & Structure
mgb.description: Course Description: Strategic management of organizations, including analysis of industries, firm resources and capabilities and corporate strategy. Strategy formulation, implementation and strategic decision-making. Firm and industry life cycles and change. Analysis of organizational design and structure including differentiation and integration.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Completion of first year courses in Graduate School of Management or the equivalent.

mgb.name: — Markets & The Firm
mgb.description: Course Description: Examines the interaction of consumers, firms and government, and the effect this interaction has on the use of resources and firm profitability. Fundamental economic concepts such as marginal analysis, opportunity cost, pricing, and externalities are introduced and applied.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate student in the Graduate School of Management.

mgb.name: — Business, Government, & the International Economy
mgb.description: Course Description: Examines the influence of government and international factors on business. Topics include distribution of income, business cycles, inflation and interest rates, the federal debt, monetary policy and international trade and finance.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGV 202AV or MGT 202A or MGP 202A.

mgb.name: — Data Analysis for Managers
mgb.description: Course Description: Introduction to statistics and data analysis for managerial decision making. Descriptive statistics, principles of data collection, sampling, quality control, statistical inference. Application of data analytic methods to problems in marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate student in the Graduate School of Management MBA program or consent of instructor.

mgb.name: — Forecasting & Managerial Research Methods
mgb.description: Course Description: Practical statistical methods for managerial decision making covers regression analysis, time series analysis and forecasting, design and analysis of experiments in managerial research and contingency table analysis. Application of these methods to marketing, finance, accounting, production, operations, and public policy.
mgb.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MGT 203A or MGP 203A or MGB 203A.

mgb.name: — Marketing Management
mgb.description: Course Description: Analysis of market opportunities, elements of market research, development of marketing strategies, market planning and implementations, and control systems.
