ems.description: Course Description: Special topics in the discipline of Materials Science & Engineering. Topics will vary by instructor.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

ems.name: — Materials Science & Engineering Seminar
ems.description: Course Description: Selected topics of current interest in Materials Science & Engineering. Subjects covered vary from year to year and are announced at the beginning of each quarter.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or consent of instructor.

ems.name: — Graduate Research Conference
ems.description: Course Description: Individual and/or group conference on problems, progress, and techniques in Materials Science & Engineering research.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

ems.name: — Materials Science & Engineering Internship
ems.description: Course Description: Work or lab experience in industry or off-campus lab focusing on Materials Science & Engineering applications at the graduate level.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Graduate level standing.

ems.name: — Materials Science Seminar
ems.description: Course Description: Current literature and developments in materials science with presentations by individual students.

ems.name: — Group Study
ems.description: Course Description: Group study.

ems.name: — Research
ems.description: Course Description: Research.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

ems.name: — The Teaching of Materials Science
ems.description: Course Description: Participation as a teaching assistant or associate-in in a designated engineering course. Methods of leading discussion groups or laboratory sections, writing and grading quizzes, use of laboratory equipment, and grading laboratory reports.
ems.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Meet qualifications for teaching assistant and/or associate-in in Materials Science  Engineering.

mcn.name: — Nutrition During Pregnancy
mcn.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Overview of the anatomical, physiological and biochemical changes that occur during pregnancy and early development. Discussion and evaluation of nutritional/lifestyle factors associated with pregnancy outcomes and nutrition programs/interventions for pregnant women.
mcn.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Acceptance into the Master of Advanced Studies in Maternal and Child Nutrition; other students by consent of instructor.

mcn.name: — Lactation & Infant Nutrition
mcn.description: Course Description: Overview of the physiological and biochemical processes underlying human lactation and nutritional needs of both mother and infant. Development of skills in assessment, nutrition counseling, education and support of new mothers and their families.

mcn.name: — Child & Adolescent Nutrition
mcn.description: Course Description: Relationships among nutrition, growth, and development during childhood and adolescence. Nutritional assessment for normal and high risk groups; psychological, social, and economic factors contributing to nutritional status. Nutritional needs and interventions for special groups, including obese children/adolescents, athletes, and eating disordered.

mcn.name: — Applied Research Methods in Maternal & Child Nutrition
mcn.description: Course Description: Application of epidemiological principles to the study of maternal and child nutrition. Topics include quantitative & qualitative study procedures, including study design, data collection, and related analytical techniques.

mcn.name: — Current Topics in Maternal & Child Nutrition: Principles of Adult Education
mcn.description: Course Description: Current scientific literature related to Maternal & Child Nutrition in adult education settings. Topics include methods and theories of adult education and critical thinking skills related to research evaluation.

mcn.name: — Current Topics in Maternal & Child Nutrition: Epidemiology & Evidence-Based Practice
mcn.description: Course Description: Current scientific literature related to Maternal & Child Nutrition. Topics include epidemiology, evidence-based practice, breastfeeding promotion, and nutritional assessment of populations.

mcn.name: — Current Topics in Maternal & Child Nutrition: Public Policy Development & Implementation
mcn.description: Course Description: Current scientific literature related to Maternal & Child Nutrition. Topics include nutrition surveillance and monitoring, as well as public policy development and implementation.

mat.name: — Elementary Algebra (no credit)
mat.description: Course Description: Basic concepts of algebra, including polynomials, factoring, equations, graphs, and inequalities. Offered only if sufficient number of students enroll.

mat.name: — Trigonometry (no credit)
mat.description: Course Description: Basic concepts of trigonometry, including trigonometric functions, identities, inverse functions, and applications. Offered only if sufficient number of students enroll.

mat.name: — Intermediate Algebra (no credit)
mat.description: Course Description: Basic concepts of algebra, prepares student for college work in mathematics, such as MAT 016A or MAT 021A. Functions, equations, graphs, logarithms, and systems of equations. Offered only if sufficient number of students enroll.

mat.name: — Precalculus
mat.description: Course Description: Topics selected for their use in calculus, including functions and their graphs, slope, zeroes of polynomials, exponential, logarithmic and trigonometric functions, sketching surfaces and solids.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school algebra, plane geometry, plane trigonometry; and obtaining required score on the Precalculus Diagnostic Examination.

mat.name: — Short Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Limits; differentiation of algebraic functions; analytic geometry; applications, in particular to maxima and minima problems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school algebra, plane geometry, plane trigonometry, and satisfying the Mathematics Placement Requirement.

mat.name: — Short Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Integration; calculus for trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions; applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016A C- or better or MAT 017A C- or better or MAT 021A C- or better or MAT 021AH C- or better.

mat.name: — Short Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Differential equations; partial derivatives; double integrals; applications; series.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016B C- or better or MAT 017B C- or better or MAT 021B C- or better or MAT 021BH C- or better.

mat.name: — Calculus for Biology & Medicine
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to differential calculus via applications in biology and medicine. Limits, derivatives of polynomials, trigonometric, and exponential functions, graphing, applications of the derivative to biology and medicine.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school algebra, plane geometry, plane trigonometry, and analytical geometry, and satisfying the Mathematics Placement Requirement.

mat.name: — Calculus for Biology & Medicine
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to integral calculus and elementary differential equations via applications to biology and medicine. Fundamental theorem of calculus, techniques of integration including integral tables and numerical methods, improper integrals, elementary first order differential equations, applications in biology and medicine.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016A C- or better or MAT 017A C- or better or MAT 021A C- or better or MAT 021AH C- or better.

mat.name: — Calculus for Biology & Medicine
mat.description: Course Description: Matrix algebra, functions of several variables, partial derivatives, systems of differential equations, and applications to biology and medicine.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 017B C- or better.

mat.name: — Calculus for Data-Driven Applications
mat.description: Course Description: Calculus and other mathematical methods necessary in data driven analysis in the sciences, technology and the humanities.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school algebra, plane geometry, plane trigonometry, and satisfying the Mathematics Placement Requirement.

mat.name: — Calculus for Data-Driven Applications
mat.description: Course Description: Calculus and other mathematical methods necessary in data driven analysis in the sciences, technology, and the humanities.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 017A C- or better or MAT 021A C- or better or MAT 021AH C- or better or MAT 019A C- or better.

mat.name: — Calculus for Data-Driven Applications
mat.description: Course Description: Calculus and other mathematical methods necessary in data-driven analysis in the sciences, technology and the humanities. Multivariable calculus, differential equations, partial derivatives.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 019B C- or better or MAT 017B C- or better or MAT 021B C- or better or MAT 021BH C- or better.

mat.name: — Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Functions, limits, continuity. Slope and derivative. Differentiation of algebraic and transcendental functions. Applications to motion, natural growth, graphing, extrema of a function. Differentials. L'Hopital's rule.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school algebra, plane geometry, plane trigonometry, and analytical geometry, and satisfying the Mathematics Placement Requirement.

mat.name: — Honors Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: More intensive treatment of material covered in MAT 021A.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): A Precalculus Diagnostic Examination score significantly higher than the minimum for MAT 021A is required.

mat.name: — Emerging Scholars Program Calculus Workshop
mat.description: Course Description: Functions, limits, continuity. Slope and derivative. Same course content as MAT 021A. Enrollment for students in the Emerging Scholars Program by instructor's invitation only.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021A required concurrently.

mat.name: — Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Continuation of MAT 021A. Definition of definite integral, fundamental theorem of calculus, techniques of integration. Application to area, volume, arc length, average of a function, improper integral, surface of revolution. May be taught abroad.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 021A C- or better or MAT 021AH C- or better) or MAT 017A B or better.

mat.name: — Honors Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: More intensive treatment of material covered in MAT 021B. Students completing MAT 021BH can continue with MAT 021CH or the regular MAT 021C.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021A B or better or MAT 021AH B or better.

mat.name: — Emerging Scholars Program Calculus Workshop
mat.description: Course Description: Continuation of MAT 021A. Same course content as MAT 021B. Enrollment for students in the Emerging Scholars Program by instructor's invitation only.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021B required concurrently.

mat.name: — Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Continuation of MAT 021B. Sequences, series, tests for convergence, Taylor expansions. Vector algebra, vector calculus, scalar and vector fields. Partial derivatives, total differentials. Applications to maximum and minimum problems in two or more variables. Applications to physical systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016C C- or better or MAT 017C C- or better or MAT 021B C- or better or MAT 021BH C- or better or MAT 017B B or better.

mat.name: — Honors Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: More intensive treatment of material covered in MAT 021C.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021B B or better or MAT 021BH B or better.

mat.name: — Emerging Scholars Program Calculus Workshop
mat.description: Course Description: Continuation of MAT 021B. Same course content as MAT 021C. Enrollment for students in the Emerging Scholars Program by instructor's invitation only.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C required concurrently.

mat.name: — Vector Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Continuation of MAT 021C. Definite integrals over plane and solid regions in various coordinate systems. Line and surface integrals. Green's theorem, Stoke's theorem, divergence theorem.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 021C C- or better or MAT 021CH C- or better) or MAT 017C B or better.

mat.name: — Accelerated Calculus
mat.description: Course Description: Accelerated treatment of material from MAT 021A and MAT 021B, with detailed presentation of theory, definitions, and proofs, and treatment of computational aspects of calculus at a condensed but sophisticated level.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Grade of B or higher in both semesters of high school calculus or a score of 4 or higher on the Advanced Placement Calculus AB exam, and obtaining the required score on the Precalculus Diagnostic Examination and its trigonometric component.

mat.name: — Linear Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Matrices and linear transformations, determinants, eigenvalues, eigenvectors, diagonalization, factorization.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 016C C- or better or MAT 017C C- or better or MAT 021C C- or better or MAT 021CH C- or better); (ENG 006 or EME 005 or ECH 060 or MAT 022AL (can be concurrent)).

mat.name: — Linear Algebra Computer Laboratory
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to MATLAB and its use in linear algebra.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016C or MAT 017C or MAT 021C or MAT 021CH.

mat.name: — Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Solutions of elementary differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 022A C- or better or MAT 067 C- or better).

mat.name: — Linear Algebra with Applications to Biology
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to linear algebra with biological, medical, and bioengineering applications. Matrix algebra, vector spaces, orthogonality, determinants, eigenvalues, eigenvectors, principal component analysis, singular value decomposition, and linear transformations. Computer labs cover mathematical and computational techniques for modeling biological systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 017C C- or better or MAT 021C C- or better or MAT 021CH C- or better.

mat.name: — Differential Equations with Applications to Biology
mat.description: Course Description: Solutions of differential equations with biological, medical, and bioengineering applications. First and second order linear equations, phase plane analysis, nonlinear dynamics, Laplace transforms, and the diffusion equation. Computer labs cover mathematical and numerical techniques for modeling biological systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 027A C- or better or BIS 027A C- or better) or (MAT 022A C- or better,  (MAT 022AL C- or better or ENG 006 C- or better or ECS 032A C- or better or ECS 036A C- or better or ECH 060 C- or better or EME 005 C- or better)).

mat.name: — Fundamentals of Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to fundamental mathematical ideas selected from the principal areas of modern mathematics. Properties of the primes, the fundamental theorems of arithmetic, properties of the rationals and irrationals, binary and other number systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the Mathematics Placement Requirement.

mat.name: — Modern Linear Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Rigorous treatment of linear algebra; topics include vector spaces, bases and dimensions, orthogonal projections, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, similarity transformations, singular value decomposition and positive definiteness.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C C- or better or MAT 021CH C- or better.

mat.name: — Explorations in Elementary Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Weekly explorations of mathematical ideas related to the elementary school curriculum will be carried out by cooperative learning groups. Lectures will provide background and synthesize the results of group exploration.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school mathematics.

mat.name: — Explorations in Elementary Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Weekly explorations of mathematical ideas related to the elementary school curriculum will be carried out by cooperative learning groups. Lectures will provide background and synthesize the results of group exploration.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Two years of high school mathematics.

mat.name: — Elementary Problem Solving
mat.description: Course Description: Solve and present solutions to challenging and interesting problems in elementary mathematics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): High school mathematics through precalculus.

mat.name: — Directed Group Study
mat.description: Course Description: Directed group study.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Special Study for Undergraduates
mat.description: Course Description: Special study for undergraduates.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Probability & Stochastic Processes with Applications to Biology
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to probability theory and stochastic processes with biological, medical, and bioengineering applications. Combinatorics, discrete and continuous random variables, Bayes’ formula, conditional probability, Markov chains, Poisson processes, and Brownian motion. Computer labs cover mathematical and computational modeling techniques.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 027A C- or better or BIS 027A C- or better) or (MAT 022A C- or better,  (MAT 022AL C- or better or ENG 006 C- or better or ECS 032A C- or better or ECS 036A C- or better or ECH 060 C- or better or EME 005 C- or better)).

mat.name: — Introduction to Abstract Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Rigorous treatment of mathematical concepts with emphasis on developing the ability to understand abstract mathematical ideas, to read and write mathematical concepts, and to prove theorems. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper division courses.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021B.

mat.name: — History of Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: History of mathematics from ancient times through the development of calculus. Mathematics from Arab, Hindu, Chinese and other cultures. Selected topics from the history of modern mathematics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 127A or MAT 067 or MAT 108 or MAT 114 or MAT 115A or MAT 141 or MAT 145; 8 units of upper division Mathematics.

mat.name: — Convex Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Topics selected from the theory of convex bodies, convex functions, geometric inequalities, combinatorial geometry, and integral geometry. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper division courses.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C; (MAT 022A or BIS 027A or MAT 067).

mat.name: — Number Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Divisibility and related topics, diophantine equations, selected topics from the theory of prime numbers. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper division courses.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021B.

mat.name: — Number Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Euler function, Moebius function, congruences, primitive roots, quadratic reciprocity law.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 115A; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A).

mat.name: — Differential Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Vector analysis, curves, and surfaces in three dimensions.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021D; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B).

mat.name: — Partial Differential Equations: Elementary Methods
mat.description: Course Description: Derivation of partial differential equations; separation of variables; equilibrium solutions and Laplace's equation; Fourier series; method of characteristics for the one dimensional wave equation. Solution of nonhomogeneous equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021D; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B).

mat.name: — Partial Differential Equations: Eigenfunction Expansions
mat.description: Course Description: Sturm-Liouville Theory; selfadjoint operators; mixed boundary conditions; partial differential equations in two and three dimensions; Eigenvalue problems in circular domains; nonhomogeneous problems and the method of eigenfunction expansions; Poisson's Equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 118A.

mat.name: — Partial Differential Equations: Green's Functions & Transforms
mat.description: Course Description: Green's functions for one-dimensional problems and Poisson's equation; Fourier transforms; Green's Functions for time dependent problems; Laplace transform and solution of partial differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 118B.

mat.name: — Ordinary Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Scalar and planar autonomous systems; nonlinear systems and linearization; existence and uniqueness of solutions; matrix solution of linear systems; phase plane analysis; stability analysis; bifurcation theory; Liapunov's method; limit cycles; Poincare Bendixon theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021D; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B).

mat.name: — Ordinary Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Lorentz equations; Poincare maps; center manifolds and normal forms; scalar and planar maps; phase space analysis for iterated maps; period-doubling bifurcation; Lyapunov exponent; chaos and symbolic dynamics; strange attractors; fractals.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 119A.

mat.name: — Mathematical Biology
mat.description: Course Description: Methods of mathematical modeling of biological systems including difference equations, ordinary differential equations, stochastic and dynamic programming models. Computer simulation methods applied to biological systems. Applications to population growth, cell biology, physiology, evolutionary ecology and protein clustering. MATLAB programming required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B).

mat.name: — Real Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Real numbers, sequences, series, and continuous functions.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 021C or MAT 021CH); (MAT 067 or (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A), MAT 108).

mat.name: — Real Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Derivatives, integrals, sequences of functions, and power series.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 127A.

mat.name: — Real Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Metric spaces and multi-variable calculus.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 127B.

mat.name: — Numerical Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Error analysis, approximation, interpolation, numerical differentiation and integration. Programming in language such as Pascal, Fortran, or BASIC required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C; (ECS 032A or ENG 006 or EME 005 or ECS 030).

mat.name: — Numerical Analysis in Solution of Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Solution of nonlinear equations and nonlinear systems. Minimization of functions of several variables. Simultaneous linear equations. Eigenvalue problems. Linear programming. Programming in language such as Pascal, Fortran, or BASIC required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (ECS 032A or ENG 006 or EME 005 or ECS 030).

mat.name: — Numerical Analysis in Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Difference equations, operators, numerical solutions of ordinary and partial differential equations. Programming in language such as Pascal, Fortran, or BASIC required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ECS 032A or ENG 006 or EME 005 or ECS 030); (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B).

mat.name: — Fourier Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Fourier series and integrals, orthogonal sets of functions. Topics selected from trigonometric approximation, orthogonal polynomials, applications to signal and image processing, numerical analysis, and differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021D; MAT 127A; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A); (MAT 022B or MAT 027B or BIS 027B):

mat.name: — Mathematical Finance
mat.description: Course Description: Analysis and evaluation of deterministic and random cash flow streams, yield and pricing of basic financial instruments, interest rate theory, mean-variance portfolio theory, capital asset pricing models, utility functions and general principles. MATLAB programming required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 067 or MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A); MAT 108; MAT 135A

mat.name: — Probability
mat.description: Course Description: Probability space; discrete probability, combinatorial analysis; independence, conditional probability; random variables, discrete and continuous distributions, probability mass function, joint and marginal density functions; expectation, moments, variance, Chebyshev inequality; sums of random variables, random walk, large number law, central limit theorem.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C; (MAT 108 or MAT 067).

mat.name: — Stochastic Processes
mat.description: Course Description: Generating functions, branching processes, characteristic function; Markov chains; convergence of random variables, law of iterated logarithm; random processes, Brownian motion, stationary processes, renewal processes, queueing theory, martingales.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 135A; (MAT 022A  or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A).

mat.name: — Euclidean Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Axiomatic and analytic examination of Euclidean geometry from an advanced point of view. In particular, a discussion of its relation to other geometries. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper division courses.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021B; (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A).

mat.name: — Combinatorics
mat.description: Course Description: Combinatorial methods using basic graph theory, counting methods, generating functions, and recurrence relations. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper division courses.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C.

mat.name: — Algebraic Combinatorics
mat.description: Course Description: Enumeration, Polya theory, generating functions, current topics in algebraic combinatorics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ((MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A,  MAT 108) or MAT 067)); MAT 145.

mat.name: — Topology
mat.description: Course Description: Basic notions of point-set and combinatorial topology.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 127A.

mat.name: — Discrete Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Coding theory, error correcting codes, finite fields and the algebraic concepts needed in their development.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 067 or (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108).

mat.name: — Modern Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Basic concepts of groups, symmetries of the plane. Emphasis on the techniques used in the proof of the ideas (Lemmas, Theorems, etc.) developing these concepts. Precise thinking, proof writing, and the ability to deal with abstraction.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 067 or (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108).

mat.name: — Modern Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Bilinear forms, rings, factorization, modules.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 150A.

mat.name: — Modern Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Group representations, fields, Galois theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 150B.

mat.name: — Mathematics & Computers
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to computational mathematics, symbolic computation, and computer generated/verified proofs in algebra, analysis and geometry. Investigation of rigorous new mathematics developed in conjunction with modern computational questions and the role that computers play in mathematical conjecture and experimentation.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 127A or MAT 108 or MAT 114 or MAT 115A or MAT 145); (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or MAT 067 or BIS 027A).

mat.name: — Applied Linear Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Applications of linear algebra; LU and QR matrix factorizations, eigenvalue and singular value matrix decompositions.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A or MAT 067.

mat.name: — Optimization
mat.description: Course Description: Linear programming, simplex method. Basic properties of unconstrained nonlinear problems, descent methods, conjugate direction method. Constrained minimization. Programming language required.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 021C; ((MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108) or MAT 067)).

mat.name: — Mathematics for Data Analytics & Decision Making
mat.description: Course Description: Relational model; relational algebra, relational calculus, normal forms, functional and multivalued dependencies, separability. Cost benefit analysis of physical database design and reorganization. Performance via analytical modeling, simulation, and queueing theory. Block accesses; buffering; operating system contention; CPU intensive operations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 167 or MAT 128B or ECS 130.

mat.name: — Special Topics
mat.description: Course Description: Special topics from various fields of modern, pure, and applied mathematics. Some recent topics include Knot Theory, General Relativity, and Fuzzy Sets.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 067 or (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108)), MAT 127A.

mat.name: — Complex Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Complex number system, analyticity and the Cauchy-Riemann equations, elementary functions, complex integration, power and Laurent series expansions, residue theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 067 or (MAT 022A or MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108)), MAT 127B.

mat.name: — Complex Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Analytical functions, elementary functions and their mapping properties, applications of Cauchy's integral theorem, conformal mapping and applications to heat flow and fluid mechanics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 185A.

mat.name: — Advanced Problem Solving
mat.description: Course Description: Solution and presentation of advanced problem solving techniques. Solve and present interesting and challenging problems of all areas of mathematics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ((MAT 022A, MAT 027A or BIS 027A, MAT 108) or MAT 067)); MAT 127A.

mat.name: — Internship in Applied Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Supervised work experience in applied mathematics. Final report.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Undergraduate Thesis
mat.description: Course Description: Independent research under supervision of a faculty member. Student will submit written report in thesis form.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Tutoring Mathematics in the Community
mat.description: Course Description: Special projects in mathematical education developing techniques for mathematics instruction and tutoring on an individual or small group basis.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Directed Group Study
mat.description: Course Description: May be taught abroad.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Special Study for Advanced Undergraduates
mat.description: Course Description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

mat.description: Course Description: Problem-solving in graduate analysis: continuous functions, metric spaces, Banach & Hilbert spaces, bounded linear operators, the spectral theorem, distributions, Fourier series & transforms, Lp spaces, Sobolev spaces.

mat.description: Course Description: Metric and normed spaces. Continuous functions. Topological, Hilbert, and Banach spaces. Fourier series. Spectrum of bounded and compact linear operators. Linear differential operators and Green's functions. Distributions. Fourier transform. Measure theory. Lp and Sobolev spaces. Differential calculus and variational methods.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in Mathematics or Applied Mathematics, or consent of instructor.

mat.description: Course Description: Analytic continuation, Riemann surfaces, conformal mappings, Riemann mapping theorem, entire functions, special functions, elliptic functions.

mat.description: Course Description: Cauchy's theorem, Cauchy's integral formulas, meromorphic functions, complex logarithm, entire functions, Weierstrass infinite product formula, the gamma and zeta functions, and prime number theorem.

mat.name: — Complex Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Conformal mappings, the Schwarz lemma, analytic automorphisms, the Riemann mapping theorem, elliptic functions, Eisenstein series, the Jacobi theta functions, asymptotics, Bessel functions, the Airy function, topics on special functions and Riemann surfaces.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 205A; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Measure Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to measure theory. The study of lengths, surface areas, and volumes in general spaces, as related to integration theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 125B.

mat.name: — Methods of Applied Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Ordinary differential equations and dynamical systems. Variational principles. Eigenfunctions, integral equations and Green's functions. Complex analysis and contour integration. Laplace's equation. Diffusion equations. Wave phenomena. Dimensional analysis and scaling. Asymptotic expansions and perturbation theory. Stochastic processes and Brownian motion.

mat.description: Course Description: Fundamental group and covering space theory. Homology and cohomology. Manifolds and duality. CW complexes. Fixed point theorems.

mat.description: Course Description: Topology of two- and three-dimensional manifolds. Surfaces and their diffeomorphisms. Dehn twists. Heegaard surfaces. Theory of 3-dimensional manifolds. Knots and knot theory. Hyperbolic manifolds and geometric structures.

mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 218B; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematical Fluid Dynamics
mat.description: Course Description: Kinematics and dynamics of fluids. The Euler and Navier-Stokes equations. Vorticity dynamics. Irrotational flow. Low Reynolds number flows and the Stokes equations. High Reynolds number flows and boundary layers. Compressible fluids. Shock waves.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 118B; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematical Fluid Dynamics
mat.description: Course Description: Kinematics and dynamics of fluids. The Euler and Navier-Stokes equations. Vorticity dynamics. Irrotational flow. Low Reynolds number flows and the Stokes equations. High Reynolds number flows and boundary layers. Compressible fluids. Shock waves.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 118B; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Numerical Methods: Fundamentals
mat.description: Course Description: Fundamental principles and methods in numerical analysis, including the concepts of stability of algorithms and conditioning of numerical problems, numerical methods for interpolation and integration, eigenvalue problems, singular value decomposition and its applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 128A; MAT 128B; or equivalent, or consent of instructor; familiarity with some programming language.

mat.name: — Numerical Methods: Large-Scale Matrix Computations
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical methods for large-scale matrix computations, including direct and iterative methods for the solution of linear systems, the computation of eigenvalues and singular values, the solution of least-squares problems, matrix compression, methods for the solution of linear programs.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 167; or equivalent, or consent of instructor; familiarity with some programming language.

mat.name: — Numerical Methods: Ordinary Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical methods for the solution of ordinary differential equations, including methods for initial-value problems and two-point boundary-value problems, theory of and methods for differential algebraic equations, dimension reduction of large-scale dynamical systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 022B; or equivalent, or consent of instructor; familiarity with some programming language.

mat.name: — Mathematical Biology
mat.description: Course Description: Nonlinear ordinary and partial differential equations and stochastic processes of cell and molecular biology. Scaling, qualitative, and numerical analysis of mathematical models. Applications to nerve impulse, chemotaxis, muscle contraction, and morphogenesis.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Numerical Solution of Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical solutions of initial-value, eigenvalue and boundary-value problems for ordinary differential equations. Numerical solution of parabolic and hyperbolic partial differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 128C.

mat.name: — Numerical Solution of Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical solutions of initial-value, eigenvalue and boundary-value problems for ordinary differential equations. Numerical solution of parabolic and hyperbolic partial differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 128C.

mat.name: — Numerical Solution of Differential Equations
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical solutions of initial-value, eigenvalue and boundary-value problems for ordinary differential equations. Numerical solution of parabolic and hyperbolic partial differential equations.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 128C.

mat.name: — Probability Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Measure-theoretic foundations, abstract integration, independence, laws of large numbers, characteristic functions, central limit theorems. Weak convergence in metric spaces, Brownian motion, invariance principle. Conditional expectation. Topics selected from: martingales, Markov chains, ergodic theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 125B; (MAT 135A or STA 131A); or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Probability Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Measure-theoretic foundations, abstract integration, independence, laws of large numbers, characteristic functions, central limit theorems. Weak convergence in metric spaces, Brownian motion, invariance principle. Conditional expectation. Topics selected from: martingales, Markov chains, ergodic theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 235A or STA 235A; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Probability Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Measure-theoretic foundations, abstract integration, independence, laws of large numbers, characteristic functions, central limit theorems. Weak convergence in metric spaces, Brownian motion, invariance principle. Conditional expectation. Topics selected from: martingales, Markov chains, ergodic theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 235B or STA 235B; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Stochastic Dynamics & Applications
mat.description: Course Description: Stochastic processes, Brownian motion, Stochastic integration, martingales, stochastic differential equations. Diffusions, connections with partial differential equations, mathematical finance.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 201C or (MAT 235B or STA 235B); MAT 235A, MAT 235B, MAT 235C/STA 235A, STA 235B, STA 235C recommended.

mat.name: — Stochastic Dynamics & Applications
mat.description: Course Description: Stochastic processes, Brownian motion, Stochastic integration, martingales, stochastic differential equations. Diffusions, connections with partial differential equations, mathematical finance.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 201C or (MAT 235B or STA 235B); MAT 235A, MAT 235B, MAT 235C/STA 235A, STA 235B, STA 235C recommended.

mat.name: — Differential Topology
mat.description: This version has ended; see updated course, below.Course Description: Topics include: differentiable manifolds, vector fields, transversality, Sard's theorem, examples of differentiable manifolds; orientation, intersection theory, index of vector fields; differential forms, integration, Stokes' theorm, deRham cohomology; Morse functions, Morse lemma, index of critical points.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 201A; or consent of instructor; Vector calculus, point-set topology; MAT 250A MAT 250B highly recommended.

mat.name: — Differential Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Riemannian metrics, connections, geodesics, Gauss lemma, convex neighborhoods, curvature tensor, Ricci and scalar curvature, connections and curvature on vector bundles.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 201A; MAT 239; MAT 250A MAT 250B highly recommended; intended primarily for second-year graduate students.

mat.name: — Differential Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Jacobi fields, conjugate points, completeness, Hopf-Rinow theorem, Cartan-Hadamard theorem, energy, variation theorems and their applications, Rauch comparison theorem and its applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 240A; Intended primarily for second-year graduate students.

mat.name: — Enumerative Combinatorics
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to modern combinatorics and its applications. Emphasis on enumerative aspects of combinatorial theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 145; MAT 150; or the equivalent, or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Algebraic Combinatorics
mat.description: Course Description: Algebraic and geometric aspects of combinatorics. The use of structures such as groups, polytopes, rings, and simplicial complexes to solve combinatorial problems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 245; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Algebraic Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Affine varieties and radical ideals. Projective varieties. Abstract varieties. Morphisms and rational maps. Smoothness. Algebraic curves and the Riemann-Roch theorem. Special topics.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 250A; MAT 250B; MAT 250C.

mat.name: — Algebraic Geometry
mat.description: Course Description: Complex varieties and the analytic topology. Sheaves and schemes. Fiber products. Separatedness and properness. Applications of scheme theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 248A.

mat.name: — Problem-Solving in Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Problem-solving in graduate algebra: groups, rings, modules, matrices, tensor products, representations, Galois theory, ring extensions, commutative algebra and homological algebra.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 250A (can be concurrent); MAT 250B (can be concurrent).

mat.name: — Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Group and rings. Sylow theorems, abelian groups, Jordan-Holder theorem. Rings, unique factorization. Algebras, and modules. Fields and vector spaces over fields. Field extensions. Commutative rings. Representation theory and its applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in mathematics or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Group and rings. Sylow theorems, abelian groups, Jordan-Holder theorem. Rings, unique factorization. Algebras, and modules. Fields and vector spaces over fields. Field extensions. Commutative rings. Representation theory and its applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in mathematics or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Algebra
mat.description: Course Description: Group and rings. Sylow theorems, abelian groups, Jordan-Holder theorem. Rings, unique factorization. Algebras, and modules. Fields and vector spaces over fields. Field extensions. Commutative rings. Representation theory and its applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in mathematics or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Numerical Optimization
mat.description: Course Description: Numerical methods for infinite dimensional optimization problems. Newton and Quasi-Newton methods, linear and sequential quadratic programming, barrier methods; large-scale optimization; theory of approximations; infinite and semi-infinite programming; applications to optimal control, stochastic optimization and distributed systems.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 025; MAT 167.

mat.name: — Discrete & Mixed-Integer Optimization
mat.description: Course Description: Combinatorial, integer, and mixed-integer linear optimization problems. Ideal and strong formulations, cutting planes, branch and cut, decomposition methods.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 025; MAT 167; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Lie Groups & Lie Algebras
mat.description: Course Description: Lie groups, examples and topological properties. Lie algebras and representation theory, and semisimple Lie algebras.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 147 and MAT 150A strongly encouraged; or equivalent; MAT 250A and MAT 215A and MAT 239 (can be concurrent) recommended.

mat.name: — Lie Groups & Their Representations
mat.description: Course Description: Lie groups and Lie algebras. Classification of semi-simple Lie groups. Classical and compact Lie groups. Representations of Lie groups and Lie algebras. Root systems, weights, Weil character formula. Kac-Moody and Virasoro algebras. Applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 215A; MAT 240A; MAT 250A; MAT 250B; or the equivalent, or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Lie Groups & Their Representations
mat.description: Course Description: Lie groups and Lie algebras. Classification of semi-simple Lie groups. Classical and compact Lie groups. Representations of Lie groups and Lie algebras. Root systems, weights, Weil character formula. Kac-Moody and Virasoro algebras. Applications.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 215A; MAT 240A; MAT 250A; MAT 250B; or the equivalent, or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematical Quantum Mechanics
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematical foundations of quantum mechanics: the Hilbert space and Operator Algebra formulations; the Schrödinger and Heisenberg equations, symmetry in quantum mechanics, basics of spectral theory and perturbation theory. Applications to atoms and molecules. The Dirac equation.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 201; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematical Statistical Mechanics & Quantum Field Theory
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematical principles of statistical mechanics and quantum field theory. Topics include classical and quantum lattice systems, variational principles, spontaneous symmetry breaking and phase transitions, second quantization and Fock space, and fundamentals of quantum field theory.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 265; or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics of Data Science
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematical methods and algorithms that are fundamental to a variety of data science applications. Theoretical foundations and inner workings of popular algorithms used in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Implementation and application of these algorithms to real-world data sets.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 127A; MAT 167; MAT 135A.

mat.name: — Applied & Computational Harmonic Analysis
mat.description: Course Description: Introduction to mathematical basic building blocks (wavelets, local Fourier basis, and their relatives) useful for diverse fields (signal and image processing, numerical analysis, and statistics). Emphasis on the connection between the continuum and the discrete worlds.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (MAT 125B or MAT 201C); (MAT 128B or MAT 167); MAT 129; or the equivalent, or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Topics in Pure & Applied Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Special topics in various fields of pure and applied mathematics. Topics selected based on the mutual interests of students and faculty.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.

mat.name: — Seminar
mat.description: Course Description: Advanced study in various fields of mathematics, including analysis, applied mathematics, discrete mathematics, geometry, mathematical biology, mathematical physics, optimization, partial differential equations, probability, and topology.

mat.name: — Group Study
mat.description: Course Description: Group study.

mat.name: — Individual Study
mat.description: Course Description: Individual study.

mat.name: — Dissertation Research
mat.description: Course Description: Dissertation research.

mat.name: — Mathematics Teaching Practicum
mat.description: Course Description: Specialist training in mathematics teaching. Teaching, training, and cross observing classes taught using large group Socratic techniques, small group guided inquiry experiences, and/or other approaches to teaching at various grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302A (can be concurrent); MAT 303A (can be concurrent); MAT 302A MAT 303A required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics Teaching Practicum
mat.description: Course Description: Specialist training in mathematics teaching. Teaching, training, and cross observing classes taught using large group Socratic techniques, small group guided inquiry experiences, and/or other approaches to teaching at various grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302B (can be concurrent); MAT 303B (can be concurrent); MAT 302B MAT 303B required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics Teaching Practicum
mat.description: Course Description: Specialist training in mathematics teaching. Teaching, training, and cross observing classes taught using large group Socratic techniques, small group guided inquiry experiences, and/or other approaches to teaching at various grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302C (can be concurrent); MAT 303B (can be concurrent); MAT 302C MAT 303C required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Curriculum Development in Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum development for all grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 303A required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Curriculum Development in Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum development for all grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 303B required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Curriculum Development in Mathematics
mat.description: Course Description: Mathematics curriculum development for all grade levels. Required for advanced degrees in mathematics education.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 303C required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics Pedagogy
mat.description: Course Description: An investigation of the interplay of mathematical pedagogy and mathematical content, including a historical survey of past and present methods in view of some of the influences that shaped their development.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302A or MAT 210AL required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics Pedagogy
mat.description: Course Description: An investigation of the interplay of mathematical pedagogy and mathematical content, including a historical survey of past and present methods in view of some of the influences that shaped their development.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302A or MAT 210AL required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Mathematics Pedagogy
mat.description: Course Description: An investigation of the interplay of mathematical pedagogy and mathematical content, including a historical survey of past and present methods in view of some of the influences that shaped their development.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 302C or MAT 210CL required concurrently or consent of instructor.

mat.name: — Teaching Assistantship Training
mat.description: Course Description: Experience in methods of assisting and teaching of mathematics at the university level. Includes discussion of lecturing techniques, running discussion sessions, holding office hours, preparing and grading of examinations, student-teacher interaction, and related topics. Required of departmental teaching assistants.
mat.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing in the Department of Mathematics.

mat.name: — Individual Study
mat.description: Course Description: Individual study of some aspect of mathematics education or a focused work on a curriculum design project under supervision of a faculty member in mathematics.

mae.name: — Engineering Experimentation & Uncertainty Analysis
mae.description: Course Description: Design and analysis of engineering experiments with emphasis on measurement standards, data analysis, regressions and general and detailed uncertainty analysis, including statistical treatment of experimental data intervals, propagation of bias and precision errors, correlated bias approximations, and using jitter programs.

mae.name: — Advanced Fluid Mechanics & Heat Transfer
mae.description: Course Description: Development of differential equations governing continuity, momentum and energy transfer. Solutions in laminar flow for exact cases, low and high Reynolds numbers and lubrication theory. Dynamics of inviscid flow.

mae.name: — Advanced Fluid Mechanics & Heat Transfer
mae.description: Course Description: Study of stability and transition to turbulence. Introduction to the physics of turbulence. Modeling of turbulence for numerical determination of momentum and heat transfer.

mae.name: — Fluid Flow & Heat Transfer
mae.description: Course Description: Design aspects of selected topics such as: heat conduction, fins; heat transport in ducts, boundary layers and separated flows; heat exchangers.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 103; ENG 105; EME 165; or equivalent.

mae.name: — Biomedical Heat & Mass Transport Processes
mae.description: Course Description: Application of principles of heat and mass transfer to biomedical systems related to heat exchange between the biomedical system and its environment, mass transfer across cell membranes and the design and analysis of artificial human organs.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 165; EBS 125; ECH 153; or the equivalent.

mae.name: — Advanced Thermodynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Study of topics important to energy conversion systems, propulsion and other systems using high temperature gases. Classical thermodynamics and quantum statistical mechanics of nonreacting and chemically reacting gases, gas mixtures, and other substances.

mae.name: — Combustion
mae.description: Course Description: Review of chemical thermodynamics and chemical kinetics. Discussion of reacting flows, their governing equations and transport phenomena; detonations; laminar flame structure and turbulent combustion.

mae.name: — Advanced Energy Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Review of options available for advanced power generation. Detailed study of basic power balances, component efficiencies, and overall powerplant performance for one advanced concept such as a fusion, magnetohydrodynamic, or solar electric powerplant.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 103; ENG 105; or the equivalent.

mae.name: — Introduction to Scientific Computing in Solid & Fluid Dynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Scientific calculations with finite element and finite difference methods for multi-dimensional problems in solid and fluid dynamics are performed with examples in C, C++, FORTRAN, and MATLAB script files. Derivation of the basic equations of motion in finite volume form with applications to elasticity, waves.

mae.name: — Mechanical Vibrations
mae.description: Course Description: Multiple degrees of freedom; damping measures; Rayleigh's method; vibration absorbers; eigenvalues and modeshapes; modal coordinates; forced vibrations; random processes and vibrations; autocorrelation; spectral density; first passage and fatigue failure; nonlinear systems; phase plane.

mae.name: — Advanced Dynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Dynamics of particles, rigid bodies and distributed systems with engineering applications; generalized coordinates; Hamilton's principle; Lagrange's equations; Hamilton-Jacobi theory; modal dynamics orthogonality; wave dynamics; dispersion.

mae.name: — Multibody Dynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Coupled rigid-body kinematics/dynamics; reference frames; vector differentiation; configuration and motion constraints; holonomicity; generalized speeds; partial velocities; mass; inertia tensor/theorems; angular momentum; generalized forces; comparing Newton/Euler, Lagrange's, Kane's methods; computer-aided equation derivation; orientation; Euler; Rodrigues parameters.

mae.name: — Spatial Kinematics & Robotics
mae.description: Course Description: Spatial kinematics, screw theory, spatial mechanisms analysis and synthesis, robot kinematics and dynamics, robot workspace, path planning, robot programming, real-time architecture and software implementation.

mae.name: — Acoustics & Noise Control
mae.description: Course Description: Description of sound using normal modes and waves; interaction between vibrating solids and sound fields; sound absorption in enclosed spaces; sound transmission through barriers; applications in design, acoustic enclosures and sound walls, room acoustics, design of quiet machinery.

mae.name: — Introduction to BioMEMS
mae.description: Course Description: Ideal for beginning graduate or advanced undergraduate students interested in microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) topics related to biological applications. Covers topics from various disciplines related to BioMEMS: mechanical, electrical, biomedical, chemical engineering, and materials science.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): B.S. engineering discipline or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Design & Analysis of Micro-Electromechanical Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Mechanical design of micro-electronmechanical systems (MEMS). Device modeling: lumped parameter models; energy methods; nonlinearities; electrical and mechanical noise sources. Actuation and measurement methods: capacitive, piezoresistive, thermal, piezoelectric, and optical techniques. Review of basic electronics: bridge circuits, amplitude modulation; lock-in detection.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ENG 045 or ENG 045Y); ENG 100; ENG 104; and consent of instructor. ENG 122 recommended.

mae.name: — Skeletal Tissue Mechanics
mae.description: Course Description: Overview of the mechanical properties of the various tissues in the musculoskeletal system, the relationship of these properties to anatomic and histologic structure, and the changes in these properties caused by aging and disease. Tissues covered include bone, cartilage and synovial fluid, ligament and tendon.

mae.name: — Design & Dynamics of Road Vehicles
mae.description: Course Description: Analysis and numerical simulation of road vehicles with on design applications.

mae.name: — Analysis & Design of Composite Structures
mae.description: Course Description: Modeling and analysis methodology for composite structures including response and failure. Laminated plate bending theory. Introduction to failure processes. Includes discussion of aerospace structural analysis.

mae.name: — Advanced Finite Elements & Optimization
mae.description: Course Description: Introduction to advanced finite elements and design optimization methods, with application to modeling of complex mechanical, aerospace and biomedical systems. Application of states of the art in finite elements in optimum design of components under realistic loading conditions and constraints.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 180 or EAD 115 or MAT 128C.

mae.name: — Computational Methods in Nonlinear Mechanics
mae.description: Course Description: Deformation of solids and the motion of fluids treated with state-of-the-art computational methods. Numerical treatment of nonlinear dynamics; classification of coupled problems; applications of finite element methods to mechanical, aeronautical, and biological systems.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EAD 115 or MAT 128B or ENG 180.

mae.name: — Micro- & Nano-Technology in Life Sciences
mae.description: Course Description: Survey of biodevice design from engineering and biological perspectives; micro-/nano-fabrication techniques; surface science and mass transport; essential biological processes and models; proposal development skills on merging aforementioned themes.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Advanced Turbomachinery
mae.description: Course Description: Preliminary aerodynamic design of axial and radial flow compressors and turbines. Design of diffusers. Selection of turbomachine  and configurations and approximations to optimum dimensions and flow angles. Introduction to through flow analysis. Rotating stall and surge, and aeromechanical considerations.

mae.name: — Advanced Methods in Mechanical Design
mae.description: Course Description: Applications of advanced techniques of solid mechanics to mechanical design problems. Coverage of advanced topics in stress analysis and static failure theories with emphasis in design of machine elements. Design projects emphasizing advanced analysis tools for life cycle evaluation.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 150A; EME 150B; or the equivalents or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Advanced Methods in Mechanical Design
mae.description: Course Description: Applications of advanced techniques of solid mechanics to mechanical design problems. Advanced topics in variational methods of mechanics with emphasis in design of machine elements. Design projects emphasizing advanced analysis tools.

mae.name: — Mechanical Performance of Materials
mae.description: Course Description: Occurrence, mechanisms, and prediction of fatigue and fracture phenomenon. Use of stress and strain to predict crack initiation. Use of fracture mechanics to predict failure and crack propagation. Effects of stress concentration, manufacturing, load sequence, irregular loading, and multi-axial loading.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Undergraduate course in stress analysis and mechanical behavior of materials.

mae.name: — Information Processing for Autonomous Robotics
mae.description: Course Description: Computational principles for sensing, reasoning, and navigation for autonomous robots.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 154; EME 171; ENG 006; EME 005; or equivalent programming experience to ENG 006 EME 005; MAE 154, MAE 171, or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Network Theory & Applications
mae.description: Course Description: Develops the mathematical theory underlying growth, structure and function of networks with applications to physical, social, biological and engineered systems. Topics include network growth, resilience, epidemiology, phase transitions, software and algorithms, routing and search control, cascading failures.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 022A; MAT 022B; (STA 013 or STA 013Y or STA 120); Experience with computer software, or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Engineering Software Design
mae.description: Course Description: Principle and design of engineering software. Advanced topics in engineering software design, applications of object-oriented programming, very high-level languages, real-time multi-thread computing and sensor fusion, Web-based network computing, graphics, and GUI in engineering.

mae.name: — Computer Aided Design & Manufacturing
mae.description: Course Description: Representation and processing of geometrical information in design and manufacturing. Numeric and symbolic computations. Coordinate systems and transformations. Bezier and B-spline curves and surfaces. Interpolation and approximation methods. Intersections, offsets, and blends. Path planning for machining, inspection, and robotics applications.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Proficiency in a high level programming language such as Fortran, Pascal or C.

mae.name: — Sustainable Manufacturing & Design
mae.description: Course Description: Definitions, methods, and dimensions of sustainability in manufacturing and product design. Emphasis on resource efficiency and life cycle engineering in the context of the production environment.

mae.name: — Hybrid Electric Vehicle System Theory & Design
mae.description: Course Description: Advanced vehicle design for fuel economy, performance, and low emissions, considering regulations, societal demands and manufacturability. Analysis and verification of computer design and control of vehicle systems in real vehicle tests. Advanced engine concepts.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 150B; graduate standing in Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering.

mae.name: — Modern Manufacturing Technologies
mae.description: Course Description: Review of manufacturing processes, simulation methods, quality control, and machine tool design. Design for manufacturing and assembly and operation management are also introduced.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 050 or equivalent is recommended.

mae.name: — Advanced Aerodynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Study of invicid and viscous flows about aerodynamic shapes at subsonic, transonic and supersonic conditions. Application of aerodynamic theory to design for reduced drag and increased lift.

mae.name: — Introduction to Computational Aerodynamics & Fluid Dynamics
mae.description: Course Description: Introduction to numerical methods for solution of fluid flow problems. Discretization techniques and solution algorithms. Finite difference solutions to classical model equations pertinent to wave phenomena, diffusion phenomena, or equilibrium. Application to the incompressible and compressible Navier-Stokes equations.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 103; ENG 105; or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Aeroacoustics
mae.description: Course Description: Introduction to acoustics, Fourier transform and sound pressure level, Green’s function, Lighthill’s acoustic analogy and jet noise, tailored Green’s function and acoustic scattering, Ffowcs Williams and Hawkings equation and rotorcraft noise, turbulence for aeroacoustics and leading-edge noise, trailing-edge noise and wind turbine noise, duct acoustics and aircraft engine noise.

mae.name: — Fuel Cell Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Basics of electrochemistry and fuel cell engines in mobile and stationary applications. Aspects of fuel cell energy converters and their subsystems including practice with existing fuel cell and hydrogen systems on campus.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 106; EME 109; EME 165; or equivalent courses, or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Advanced Modeling & Simulation of Mechatronic Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Multiport models of mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and thermal devices; bond graphs, block diagrams and state space equations; modeling of multiple energy domain systems; three-dimensional mechanics; digital simulation laboratory.

mae.name: — Theory & Design of Control Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Mathematical representations of linear dynamical systems. Feedback principles; benefits and cost of feedback. Analysis and design of control systems based on classical and modern approaches, with emphasis on applications to mechanical and aeronautical systems.

mae.name: — Single Input Single Output (SISO) Optimal Robust Control
mae.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of SISO (Single Input Single Output) feedback control systems utilizing Youla Parameterization technique. Optimal control concepts (controllability, observability, Linear Quadratic Regulator) and an introduction to Kalman filtering and robust optimal control theory for designing H2/LQG and Hinf controllers.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 172; MAE 272; or consent of instructor. EEC 250 recommended.

mae.name: — Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) Optimal Robust Control
mae.description: Course Description: Analysis and design of MIMO (Multiple Input Multiple Output) feedback control systems utilizing Youla Parameterization technique. Uncertainty modeling and  MIMO feedback control system design using loop shaping with Hinf/H2 system norm optimization techniques.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAE 272; MAE 273A; or consent of instructor.

mae.name: — Guidance & Control of Unmanned Aerial Systems
mae.description: Course Description: Introduction to Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS). Challenges in guiding and controlling limited-payload small and miniature aircraft systems. Coordinate frames, kinematics and dynamics, linear design models, autopilot design, sensor models, state estimation, design model for guidance, straight-line and orbit following, and path planning.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 102; EME 172; or consent of instructor. Familiarity with simulation tools, such as Matlab/Simulink, expected.

mae.name: — Data Acquisition & Analysis
mae.description: Course Description: Application of computers for data acquisition and control. Topics include computer architecture, characteristics of transducers, hardware for laboratory applications of computers, fundamentals of interfaces between computers and experimental equipment, programming techniques for data acquisition and control, basic data analysis.

mae.name: — Graduate Research Conference
mae.description: Course Description: Individual and/or group conference on problems, progress, and techniques in mechanical and aeronautical engineering research.

mae.name: — SEMINAR
mae.description: Course Description: Current topics in engineering including developments in mechanical and aeronautical engineering with presentations by students, faculty, and visitors.

mae.name: — Group Study
mae.description: Course Description: Group study.

mae.name: — Research
mae.description: Course Description: Research.

mae.name: — Teaching of Aeronautical Science & Engineering
mae.description: Course Description: Methods of leading discussion groups or laboratory sections, writing and grading quizzes, use of laboratory equipment, and grading laboratory reports.
mae.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Meet qualifications for teaching assistant and/or associate-in in Aeronautical Science and Engineering.

mae.name: — Teaching Assistant Training Practicum
mae.description: Course Description: Teaching assistant training.

eme.name: — Mechanical Engineering
eme.description: Course Description: Description of the field of mechanical engineering with examples taken from industrial applications, discussions of the practice with respect to engineering principles, ethics, and responsibilities.

eme.name: — Computer Programming for  Engineering Applications
eme.description: Course Description: Structured programming in C for solving problems in engineering. Introduction to MATLAB and comparison study of C/C++ with MATLAB.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): MAT 016A (can be concurrent) or MAT 021A (can be concurrent).

eme.name: — Manufacturing Processes
eme.description: Course Description: Modern manufacturing methods, safety, manufacturing instructions, computer-aided manufacturing and their role in the engineering design and development process.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 004 C- or better; PHY 009A C- or better.

eme.name: — Internship in Mechanical Engineering
eme.description: Course Description: Supervised work-study experience in engineering.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Lower division standing; approval of project prior to period of internship.

eme.name: — Mentoring & Tutoring Engineering in the Community
eme.description: Course Description: Mentoring, coaching, tutoring and/or supervision of students in K-12 schools in Engineering-related topics.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.

eme.name: — Special Study for Undergraduates
eme.description: Course Description: Special study for undergraduates.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Lower division standing.

eme.name: — Thermo-Fluid Dynamics
eme.description: Course Description: Inviscid incompressible flow, compressible flow, ideal gas mixtures, psychrometrics, reacting mixtures and combustion.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 103 C- or better; ENG 105 C- or better.

eme.name: — Measurement Systems
eme.description: Course Description: Experiments to illustrate principles of mechanical systems. Signal analysis; Demonstration of basic sensors for mechanical systems; Experimental project design; Experiments involving voltage measurement; strain gauges, dynamic systems of 1st order.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 100 C- or better; ENG 102 C- or better; ENG 104 recommended.

eme.name: — Experimental Methods for Thermal Fluids
eme.description: Course Description: Experiments illustrating principles of thermal-fluid systems and related measurement devices. Statistical design of experiments and uncertainty analysis of data; thermodynamic cycles, combustion, compressible and incompressible flows.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 106 C- or better.

eme.name: — Introduction to Numerical Analysis & Methods
eme.description: Course Description: Number representation, Taylor expansions, error  and stability analysis, roots of nonlinear equations, sets of linear equations, numerical integration, ordinary differential equations.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ENG 006 C- or better or EME 005 C- or better or ECS 030 C- or better or ECS 032A C- or better or ECS 036A C- or better or ECH 060 C- or better or ECM 006 C- or better); ((MAT 021A C- or better,  MAT 021B C- or better,  MAT 021C C- or better,  MAT 021D C- or better,  (MAT 022A C- or better or MAT 027A C- or better),  (MAT 022B C- or better or MAT 027B C- or better)),  (PHY 009A C- or better,  PHY 009B C- or better,  PHY 009C C- or better).

eme.name: — Engineering Applications of Dynamics
eme.description: Course Description: Technical elective that revisits dynamic principles with emphasis on engineering applications; Equations of motion are derived and put into a format for computer solution; There is a computer laboratory where real engineering systems are simulated.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 102 C- or better; (ENG 006 C- or better or EME 005 C- or better or ECS 030 C- or better).

eme.name: — Vehicle Stability
eme.description: Course Description: Analytical and experimental studies of the dynamics, stability and control of vehicles such as cars, trailers, airplanes, motorcycles, bicycles and rail cars.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 102 C- or better.

eme.name: — Stability of Flexible Dynamic Systems
eme.description: Course Description: Stability of flexible systems. Introduction to fluid-structure interaction. Mechanical vibrations. Design of mechanical subsystems or systems under constraints. Dynamic instabilities. Flutter. Control effectiveness. Energy extraction from fluid-structure interactions. Design applications to aerospace, mechanical and biomedical systems.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 102 C- or better; ENG 103 C- or better.

eme.name: — Mechanical Design
eme.description: Course Description: Principles of mechanics applied to design. Deformation and stress analysis. Structural integrity under static and fluctuating loads. Projects demonstrate progression from concept to engineering analysis, with emphasis on strength and durability.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): (ENG 045 C- or better or ENG 045Y C- or better); (ENG 104 C- or better,  EME 050 C- or better (can be concurrent)).

eme.name: — Mechanical Design
eme.description: Course Description: Principles of engineering mechanics applied to the design and selection of mechanical components. Design projects, which concentrate on conceptual design, engineering analysis, methods of manufacture, material selection, and cost.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 150A C- or better.

eme.name: — Statistical Methods in Design & Manufacturing
eme.description: Course Description: Methods of statistical analysis with emphasis on applications in mechanical design and manufacturing. Applications include product evaluation and decision making, probabilistic design, systems reliability, and fatigue under random loading.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 150A C- or better.

eme.name: — Computer-Aided Mechanism Design
eme.description: Course Description: Principles of computer-aided mechanism design. Computer-aided kinematic, static, and dynamic analysis and design of planar mechanisms such as multiple-loop linkages and geared linkages. Introduction to kinematic synthesis of mechanisms.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 102 C- or better; (EME 005 C- or better or ENG 006 C- or better or ECS 030 C- or better).

eme.name: — Mechatronics
eme.description: Course Description: Overview of mechatronics system and control system design concepts, control software architecture, control hardware architecture, microcontroller and interface technology for mechatronics control, sensor for mechatronics systems, actuator drives.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): ENG 100 C- or better; ENG 102 C- or better; EME 050 C- or better.

eme.name: — Combustion & the Environment
eme.description: Course Description: Introduction to combustion kinetics; premixed and diffusion flames; turbulent combustion; pollutant formation; examples of combustion devices such as internal combustion engines, gas turbines, furnaces and incinerators; alternative fuels.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 106 C- or better.

eme.name: — Internal Combustion Engines & Future Alternatives
eme.description: Course Description: Fundamentals of internal combustion engine design and performance. Future needs to adapt to environmental concerns, and the feasibility of better alternatives in the future.
eme.prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): EME 050 C- or better; EME 106 C- or better.

eme.name: — Introduction to Heating, Ventilation & Air Conditioning Systems
